Name: ratecurrency@magner
Comment_Body: 1. You first need to Fork this repository (by clicking Fork at the top), so you have a copy you can freely edit 2. Visit your Fork on your account, then git clone that. 3. Now you can use a git gui (like GitKraken or SmartGit) or you use the terminal. gui is usually easier when you start out. 4. Create a new branch ```git branch <your-feature>``` 5. Switch to your new branch ```git checkout <your-feature>``` 6. Set the upstream for the branch ```git branch --set-upstream-to origin/<your-feature>``` 7. Create new files, add your feature and stuff (everything is tracked) 8. Stage all new files and changes ```git add -A``` 9. Commit your changes ```git commit -m <What feature does as a short description>``` 10. Push you changes to your actual fork ```git push```  Then you can actually create a PR from that easily on github. If you want to add more stuff, do stuff from number 7. again to add to your PR.

In step 6, your team didn’t work, instead of it, git push --set-upstream origin <your-feature> worked It would be nice to add this instruction to the README.md file of this repository

That way when you push that branch we should only get the intended changes. I stuck a simple git primer onto the readme of the themes repository, if that helps.  Regards  Simon

Regards  Simon  On Wed, 2 Oct 2019, 21:58 Fabian Röling, <notifications@github.com> wrote:  >  * Applet version/Build date: 4.2.0 >  * Cinnamon version: 3.2.7 >  * Distribution: Debian 9.11 > > *Notify author of applet* > @claudiux <https://github.com/claudiux> > > *Issue* > > Almost every day Spices Update notifies me of an update for itself. The > applets menu does indeed let me update the applet, but the version number > doesn't change, there is nothing new in the changelog, I see no different > functionality and I generally doubt that a relatively simple applet like > this needs daily updates anyway. So I assume that this is a bug, that the > versions are indeed identical. > > — > You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread. > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub > <https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/issues/2610?email_source=notifications&email_token=ABQHSMIWJMTFEZHVG2EVEL3QMUDP5A5CNFSM4I43L4DKYY3PNVWWK3TUL52HS4DFUVEXG43VMWVGG33NNVSW45C7NFSM4HPHV36A>, > or mute the thread > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABQHSMJADPDSQ23CU2ZSEKDQMUDP5ANCNFSM4I43L4DA> > . >

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: I have also been experiencing this. It seems a little incongruous that this applet, which is supposed to make it _more_ convenient to update spices, now nags me nearly every day to update itself. Given the purpose of this module, it seems like it might be a better strategy to accumulate the new translations and release an update once a week ?  Maybe it's different for users with dozens of spices installed, the likelihood of an update being needed every day would certainly increase, but for most of us, we see a spice update maybe once in a week or two. Updates to this spice should not be so frequent that 90% of the time this is the only spice to be updated !

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: @Fabian42 i have found a workaround to the annoying updates  ![spices workaround](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4586381/66192149-c4e7a680-e687-11e9-8f35-bdf907687149.png)

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: @Fabian42 This menu appears only for Cinnamon 4.2 and you have Cinnamon 3.2. See https://cinnamon-spices.linuxmint.com/applets/view/309, please.  @Fabian42 and @acornforth Some users require improvements ; translators update .po files (many thanks to them!) Question : Should I make the improvements you require, which will generate new updates, or do not do so that you will not be bothered by these updates? ;)

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: I didn't say you should never update the applet, I say that you should bundle changes. Nobody else actually releases daily, except if the deployment process is automated (which it isn't, every single user gets a notification and every single user needs to manually click to update the applet. Or they get annoyed with the notification on every reboot.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: @Fabian42 You can choose, in the General tab of the settings of this applet, not to send a notification. Thus, Spices Update will work as mintupdate, only changing the color of its icon when updates are available.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: that is how I have mine configured... unfortunately because the applet itself give no indication about which applet needs an update...it then requires several clicks to open up the applet manager and discover that the only applet needing an update is this one... i'm with Fabian here...  I wouldn't want to deprive anyone of a much needed update...  I also don't think a weekly release cycle for new translations would be too out of order this would still be faster than just about any spice in this repo..i am simply suggesting you pick a release cycle more in alignment with the purpose of the applet.... which is more than just to update itself every day.  FWIW :I think this is a great applet. and a much needed addition to cinnamon. I just feel it could be better by addressing these very small niggles

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: to clarify...i would still want to check for updates daily or hourly.... I just don't want this applet to be the only one I see listed 90 percent of the time

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: perhaps being able to set how often to check for updates on a per applet basis.... could be a long term solution to please everyone... or have a special setting for this applet to only check for update once a week? those waiting for fixes would still be able to update manually of course !

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: Almost daily updates
Comment_Body: @acornforth  To know which Spices need an update, hover over the Spices Update icon with your mouse.  Translations are needed by many people. Out of respect for non-English speakers, it is good that these translations become available quickly.  I will not make an exception for my own applet in the treatment of Spices.  In addition, this would cause a new update of Spices Update ... which you do not want anymore.

Name: Finnish translation attached
Comment_Body: Hi @mahtiankka,  Thank you for your Finnish translation of Spices Update messages!  You can open a PR (Pull Request) to propose it. Here is a How-To: https://github.com/claudiux/docs/blob/master/HOW_TO_MAKE_A_CLEAN_REFORK.md  If you prefer, I can use you fi.po file to do a PR myself.  Regards. Claudiux

Name: Finnish translation attached
Comment_Body: @mahtiankka I see you do not have a fork of cinnamon-spices-applets. You can use this Github method:  - Fork https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets - In your fork, create a branch from the master one that you name `SpicesUpdate-fi`. - In this branch, go into `SpicesUpdate@claudiux / files / SpicesUpdate@claudiux / po`. - Add your file `fi.po` (not the zip file) and submit it with the Comment: `[SpicesUpdate@claudiux] - Finnish translation`. - Return to the root of your branch then make a Pull Request.

Name: configure to monitor wireguard connection
Comment_Body: Hi @leonzon,  Please, when you open an issue, mention the author in the message (@claudiux for me) and write the name of the applet in the title, as : `[vpnLookOut@claudiux] configure to monitor wireguard connection`.  This applet uses NetworkManager to manage connections. Mint 19.2 contains a version of NetworkManager (1.10.14) that does not support wireguard connections.  A plugin has been developed: https://git.ukamnya.ru/mirror/network-manager-wireguard-upstream. I did not test it.  Regards. Claudiux

Name: [batterymonitor@pdcurtis] Persistent notification about "User difined alarm sound selection" !
Comment_Body: @Nokia808 This is not an error, it is a feature and it is quite deliberate that one is reminded every start up.   The only point in an audible alert is to attract attention when one is away from the machine otherwise the modal alert stops you doing anything. It has to be a sound that is loud, long and attention grabbing. The one I use personally is a sound file I found for which is used somewhere for emergency evacuation of a building which cuts through most background and the effect in a quiet library, workplace or train at full volume could cause some concern. This is actually discussed in help file.  What I am considering is putting an additional checkbox in the settings to inhibit this notification for those who do not need it the next time I do an update.  In the meantime if you really have a real problem with this you could comment out the line in `.local/share/cinnamon/applets/batterymonitor@pdcurtis/3.2/applet.js` at about  line 171 starting `Main.warningNotify`  Can you also please close this as an issue or change it to a [Feature Request]

It seems to be a Cinnamon issue as the enhancement is new and is only available on 4.2 so I may be the first user.

However, I'm still seeing that add a check box within notification itself when appear from your applet itself, checking it lead to disable such notification, is still nice feature making your applet more brilliant.  Thanks!

Name: batterymonitor@pdcurtis: applet doesn't track the battery when I switched to another user
Comment_Body: This strange behaviour had a simple cause. I was using two temporary files in /tmp which had the wrong permissions when switching users. I have now moved them to the home folder so each applet is totally independent.   I have always logged out then into a new user so I missed it - I have never trusted switching with encrypted folders but you forced me to test it out!  NOTE: you will need to update the applet for each user to version 1.3.8 when the PR is accepted and it  will then also work under cinnamon 4.2  @VijitCoder  Thanks for spotting this.

Name: [text-to-speech-applet@cardsurf] Please give support for espeak-ng engine
Comment_Body: @cardsurf  Hi. Great work ! I receive new version & I changed the command from: "espeak -ven+m5 -a 100 -p 50 -s 175" (the default command) into: "espeak-ng -ven+m5 -a 100 -p 50 -s 175" & it worked !  Just if you can help me further: does what I did by change espeak" to "espeak-ng" is correct ? What about other parameters: "-ven+m5 -a 100 -p 50 -s 175" ? Leave them without change ? Are they compatible with espeak-ng or some of them need modifications ?    I have no experience with enspeak or enspeak-ng command line options & this is the 1st time to me to use TTS utility on Linux ........

Name: [text-to-speech-applet@cardsurf] Please give support for espeak-ng engine
Comment_Body: @Nokia808 Changing from `espeak` to `espeak-ng` is enough. According to [`espeak-ng` project README.md](https://github.com/espeak-ng/espeak-ng#espeak-compatibility) file the command line arguments are compatible with `espeak` command: > The espeak-ng binaries use the same command-line options as espeak, with several additions to provide new functionality from espeak-ng such as specifying the output audio device name to use.

Name: SSH Connect Panel applet
Comment_Body: Hello, @foobar-beer.  I have a couple of suggestions for you.  You have hard-coded the configuration file to be inside the applet folder. This will cause the configuration file to be overwritten every time the applet is updated by the user, loosing all configurations. You can simply implement the Cinnamon's settings system on your applet. You can read the documentation about how to implement it (see at the end).  And here comes the nightmare part (LOL). You are using a terminal extracted from a setting. But you are using CLI parameters that are used very differently by different terminals.  - The `-t` (or `--title`) parameter in **Gnome Terminal**, depending on the distribution and the version of **Gnome Terminal**, may not exist at all because it was removed at some point upstream and added back by some forks. - The `-t` parameter in **Xterm** means a totally different thing. - In **Terminator** is used the `-T` parameter (uppercase). - In **Tilda** the `-t` parameter is used to set transparency.  The point is, you can't rely on the `-t` parameter to set the title of a random terminal. There is a somewhat universal way to set a terminal title *on-the-fly*; by executing the command `echo -ne "\033]0;SOME TITLE HERE\007"`.  And the nightmare continues. The `-e` parameter is also problematic because in **Gnome Terminal** the `-e` parameter was removed (around 3.32 I think).  And lastly, you can avoid all function bindings (the use of `.bind(this)`) by simply using arrow functions. This isn't an issue at all, I'm just informing you that you could (not all JavaScript changes are useless syntactic sugar after all (LOL)).  ### Documentation  For an updated documentation, install the packages `devhelp` and `cinnamon-doc`. Then open Devhelp from your applications menu. It not only contains a more up-to-date documentation that the one on-line, but also has documentations about the **St** library and Cinnamon's JavaScrit modules.  For documentation about GObject libraries (Clutter, GLib, Gio, etc.), exists [this on-line documentation](https://lazka.github.io/pgi-docs/) that can also be [downloaded for off-line use](https://github.com/lazka/pgi-docs) as a static HTML site, and also can be downloaded as [Devhelp books](https://github.com/pygobject/pgi-docs-devhelp).

Name: New Redshift UI Applet
Comment_Body: Hello, everybody.  @raphaelquintao: You could use the `cinnamon-version` key on the applet metadata.json file. It's a mandatory key for extensions, but optional for applets/desklets. But you cannot specify a minimum Cinnamon version; you will have to specify every version the applet works on. For example:  ```json "cinnamon-version": [     "3.8",     "4.0",     "4.2" ] ```  And the installation and activation of the applet on a non listed Cinnamon version is not blocked; a warning message is displayed instead:  > Extension <UUID> is not compatible with current version of cinnamon. Using it may break your system. Load anyway?  ***  > I will consider a better icon.  You could make them configurable by the user using the `iconfilechooser` setting type; if there are custom icons, use them, else use the default ones. Just an idea.

Name: asl@santiago: Information to American Sign Language vocabulary, addin…
Comment_Body: Thanks for contributing to cinnamon spices. I have a few remarks though:  (1) The applet is broken. When I try to add it to the panel, the applet doesn't show up. -> The uuid in the metadata is not correct. (2) It's in Spanish ("Abecedario" instead of "Alphabet", "Letra X" instead of "Letter X"). -> The applet should be written/coded in English and then should be translated with gettext to any other language. (3) The applet is just opening a website, where a short video is showing the letter in ASL. I like the idea of an ASL applet, but what is the advantage of this applet in contrast to googling?

Name: asl@santiago: Information to American Sign Language vocabulary, addin…
Comment_Body: Greetings Niko, I hope these points can help in answering your questions: **EDIT:** Manage to fix a couple of things  (1) I guess that I forgot to do a minor change on the metadata, let me see if it is what I think and change it, else if you can help me out since I am kind of new to this world of Cinnamon spices; and after testing I guess it worked previously (at least on my Linux Mint VM) but I may have failed one last thing **EDIT:** I manage to do the changes and synchronize them with my personal repository, but they still require testing to check if things works well  (2) I didn't know that particular situation about coding in English only and then translate it, I was hoping to do that in a future version, ~~but right now I am having issues on my applet regarding the translate and gettext part; because if I add those (import and code per the documentation) the applet doesn't run at all~~ **EDIT:** I manage to fix this part, but I am not sure if I should add it to this PR or if wait for the approval (if it happens) and then add it later  (3) My original idea was to somehow show a small video from Youtube or any other site that opens on the very same applet (kind of an internal media player which, as far as I know, is not possible) which shows how to do the sign, so the current behaviour of the applet is as intended to work for now (I may probably plan something else if I am able to keep learning about xlets). ~~since I need to work with some people I know and/or find a place to upload the video and show it~~.    I am not really sure if my aim or my idea is way easier than googling and it is really hard to explain, but in my personal experience if I want to look for particular words; let's say "movie", "alone", "uncle"; on Google (if I keep going with the examples) I will type something like "word movie in ASL", but instead of getting the word and the "translation" or the page; I will get results of movies that explain what is ASL. All of the above is why I am creating the applet, so I can centralize the effort and make things easier for any user and/or at least those who are learning or want to learn ASL (myself included)  (This may be irrelevant to the PR but I wanted to say this) Now, there might be some problems and I can cite some of them:  * Not many sites would like to provide their information for free (the one I am putting at least is fine while I cite them as reference), if the website (or the many websites) doesn't want to do this I have to find a way in the future that doesn't break the behaviour of the applet * It is hard to take a particular sign movement as standard since, for example, my mentor sometimes does words with variations that, until now, I have been unable to understand why it is different from the ones on the internet * As a particular situation on my country (and something that my mentor blames also) is that because people wouldn't understand the "English" on the ASL, they decided to initialize many signs and not many people understand the "pure ASL" so we have a mixture on those * This is not a problem itself, but I noticed (and my mentor told me after I asked), that not many people outside of non-technical careers are interested in learning ASL, however, we all use any OS (Android, Linux, Mac, Windows) and it would be great to show exactly a technological way (if I can say it that way) of learning sign language  **EDIT:** rephrased a little bit my idea and now I talked with the persons (once again, a little bit irrelevant to the PR and the code but I also wanted to express it anyway), they are not willing to help me at full time (at least with consulting) since they fully commit to teach ASL and another sign language and I can't pay for their time (be it monetarily or any other way) but will be watching any progress from my side and if I "teach" the signs as intended since they want people to spread the word about sign language and to make people understand why it is important, besides they barely have any time off (neither of them are technical either, so any technological effort from any side it is very welcome as long as the teaching can be done perfectly out of respect to all deaf people  Hope this can help you and if you need something else from me please let me know, also I will try to keep reading documentation (which so far I have been between googling, the information of mint-doc + devhelp package, the current developer site and "reverse engineering" the behaviour of other applets as well) and request some help from you or someone else, so we can work this out. Kind regards

Comment_Body: Yep, same issue on my device: `error t=2019-05-06T10:27:24.612Z [Applet "hwmonitor@sylfurd"]: Failed to evaluate 'main' function on applet: hwmonitor@sylfurd/27 error t=2019-05-06T10:27:24.612Z Could not load applet hwmonitor@sylfurd`

Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: I have looked at the code right where it happened, and that is code that is executed every time the applet is initiated when Cinnamon starts up. It is complaining about a javascript function Array.fill() that should exist without any problems, and it does obviously for almost everyone. If it is not, like in your case, I can only assume that Cinnamon has not started up correctly for some reason, and therefor not given this applet access to Array.fill().  Is this repeatable for you @jkirk and @fireraiserDE? Or did this just happen once and then never again? If it is repeatable, I would love to see a full log, from boot up to the hwmonitor applet load, to see if something happened outside of the applet that have affected it negatively...  At least, I cannot see how this can be a problem with the code in the applet, but I am fairly new to applets in Cinnamon so I can have missed something.

Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: Hi @Hultan, thx for taking time and looking into it.  I just updated the applet to https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/commit/bad1c72124614c262a0092aab8bc8181c77ce4b2 and still get the same error. After fiddling around a bit I ended up removing `.fill(0)` from that [line](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/master/hwmonitor@sylfurd/files/hwmonitor@sylfurd/applet.js#L187) - which seems to work. So now I wonder what the constructor is supposed to do. Do you mind to explain?  ```     _init: function (_area, _provider, panel_height) {         this.width = (panel_height * ScaleRatio) - 3;          this.datas = Array(this.width).fill(0);          for (let i = 0; i < this.datas.length; i++) {             this.datas[i] = 0;         }          this.height = panel_height - 2;         this.provider = _provider;  }, ```  Because the `for` block seems to fill the `datas` array with zeros which is - as far as I understand - the same what `fill(0)` is doing.  Disclaimer: I am no JS developer at all, so please don't be to hard if I misinterpret some things.  Another thing which is interesting too, is the question how to check if `fill` is implemented in Cinnamon or in Debian.

Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: Hi @jkirk,  I did not write this plugin originally, I started to add some functionality to it only a few days ago. I think the original author have left the scene, so to speak. At least, I have not heard from him/her...  About the constructor error, I think that you are right: The fill(0) part and the loop following seems to do the same thing. So it can probably be removed, like you suggested:    this.datas = Array(this.width);  It is weird though, that you get this error but I am not, and obviously most people are not. What version of Cinnamon are you running? You can check this by running:    cinnamon --version  in a terminal  I am currently working on implementing a mode for vertical panels, but after that I will look at fixing this.

Try this version and hopefully it will work better for you.  Please do come back with your Cinnamon version anyway, I want to understand why that bug occurs for you, but not for me. The Cinnamon version might be the reason behind that...I guess...

My Cinnamon version is 3.2.7 (as stated in the facts of this issue),   I updated the applet to https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/commit/1c895ee04f67cdd757da9977af1cfa5cddf1e2f8 and adding the applet works without problems. :tada:  So technically this issue is now resolved for me. Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: Haha, I am sorry, you DID mention your Cinnamon version in your first post. My bad...:-)  Even though I personally have only used Cinnamon 4+ (new to Linux), I do know that something big probably happened around 3.2. Many applets do contain checks if the Cinnamon version is at 3.2, and then do things differently. I have not looked in to what they do differently though, but fill() could be on thing that was added in 3.2, I guess!? And maybe it doesn't work 100% in the early 3.2-versions? I am just guessing here though...  I think you can close this issue now, and if it occurs again, please do open a new issue. I can't close the issue myself, I guess I don't have the needed permissions.

Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: Hello, everybody.  @Hultan & @jkirk: It doesn't depend so much on the Cinnamon version, but on the version of the JavaScript engine (SpiderMonkey/libmozjs) a Cinnamon version is tied to. If I remember correctly, Cinnamon 3.2.x is still tied to SpiderMonkey 24. And in SpiderMonkey 24 `Array.prototype.fill()` doesn't exist (it was introduced in [Firefox 31](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Array/fill#Browser_compatibility)). I think that around Cinnamon 3.4.x or 3.6.x it started to use SpiderMonkey 38 and in Cinnamon 3.8.x it started to use SpiderMonkey 52.

Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: Thanks @Odyseus for the clarification. I think that settles it then, that would explain why @jkirk got this error. I think this issue can be closed now, I don't have permission to do so...

Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: @Odyseus: Cool! Thx for that explanation. And yes, JFTR, Debian/stretch comes with `libmozjs v24`: ``` % dpkg -l | grep libmozjs ii  libmozjs-24-0:amd64                          24.2.0-5.1+b2                               amd64        Spidermonkey JavaScript engine ``` Thx for the link on how to check in which version a JS-function is implemented. This way it makes some things much easier to debug.   And also thanks to @Hultan for your support and quick response!  (I can close the bug. Will do so now. :smiley:)

Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: After updating the applet to the latest version (https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/commit/ad53c5a3), it again can not be added to the panel. I am reopening this issue as my environment (still Cinnamon v3.2.7 and `libmozjs v24`) did not change.  The `glass.log` looks like this when trying to add the applet: ``` error t=2019-10-14T13:39:06.992Z class is a reserved identifier trace t=2019-10-14T13:39:06.993Z■ <---------------- @/home/jkirk/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/hwmonitor@sylfurd/applet.js:42 Extension.prototype._init@/usr/share/cinnamon/js/ui/extension.js:155 Extension@/usr/share/cinnamon/js/ui/extension.js:116 loadExtension@/usr/share/cinnamon/js/ui/extension.js:449 onEnabledAppletsChanged@/usr/share/cinnamon/js/ui/appletManager.js:235 ----------------> error t=2019-10-14T13:39:06.993Z [Applet "hwmonitor@sylfurd"]: Error importing applet.js from hwmonitor@sylfurd error t=2019-10-14T13:39:06.993Z Could not load applet hwmonitor@sylfurd ```  I've bisected the source and found out that the applet broke for me in commit https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/commit/be1ad79874f97c78f6038c37167337cc98bbd472 but there the `glass.log` looked a bit different:  ``` error t=2019-10-14T13:40:11.501Z class is a reserved identifier trace t=2019-10-14T13:40:11.501Z■ <---------------- Extension.prototype._init@/usr/share/cinnamon/js/ui/extension.js:155 Extension@/usr/share/cinnamon/js/ui/extension.js:116 loadExtension@/usr/share/cinnamon/js/ui/extension.js:449 onEnabledAppletsChanged@/usr/share/cinnamon/js/ui/appletManager.js:235 ----------------> error t=2019-10-14T13:40:11.501Z [Applet "hwmonitor@sylfurd"]: Error importing applet.js from hwmonitor@sylfurd error t=2019-10-14T13:40:11.501Z Could not load applet hwmonitor@sylfurd ```  Can you help me pinpoint the problem or anything I can do to help to do so?

Name: [hwmonitor@sylfurd]: Can not add to panel
Comment_Body: @jkirk   Adding a random number following a question mark to the url given by the Download button of a Spice web page allows to bypass all proxy: a particular request is sent to the server, which returns the right zip file.  Start over again the procedure above, then replace the content of the `metadata.json` file by this one before restarting Cinnamon: ``` {     "multiversion": true,     "cinnamon-version": [         "3.2",         "3.4",         "3.6",         "3.8",         "4.0",         "4.2",         "4.3"     ],     "max-instances": "1",     "dangerous": false,     "description": "Displaying realtime CPU and memory load",     "uuid": "hwmonitor@sylfurd",     "version": "1.0.0",     "name": "Graphical hardware monitor",     "last-edited": 1571339171 } ```

Name: hwmonitor@sylfurd Not showing new data after system standby
Comment_Body: @Hultan I have found a solution to this problem.  After a wake up, the delta value in the get_data() function becomes "highly negative". The solution is to store the previous value of delta and to restore it when delta becomes lesser than -50000.  ``` CpuDataProvider.prototype = {      _init: function(){         this.gtop = new GTop.glibtop_cpu();         this.current = 0;         this.last = 0;         this.usage = 0;         this.last_total = 0;         this.last_delta = 0;         this.name = _("CPU");         this.type = "CPU";     },      getData: function() {         GTop.glibtop_get_cpu(this.gtop);          this.current = this.gtop.idle;          let delta = this.gtop.total - this.last_total;         //global.log("Moniteur: delta " + delta );         if (delta < -50000) {             delta = this.last_delta;         }         if (delta > 0) {             this.usage = (this.current - this.last) / delta;             this.last = this.current;             this.last_total = this.gtop.total;             this.last_delta = delta;         }          return 1 - this.usage;     } }; ```  I will make a PR.

Name: hwmonitor@sylfurd Not showing new data after system standby
Comment_Body: Awesome! Fantastic news.../Hultan

Name: sysmonitor@orcus: polish translation; new screenshot; new default settings
Comment_Body: Hi, thank you for the translation, but I have to say I don't agree with the rest.  What is the reasoning for changing default values and screenshot? The proposed default values only change the applet padding and whether the border is drawn, which I consider subjective if a user likes this more than the current default values and if not, they can always change it in the settings. Custom padding also overrides the default Cinnamon applet padding, which I believe should not be overridden by default. The proposed screenshot shows a horizontal applet with proposed default settings, but the current screenshot shows both horizontal and vertical applet while the vertical is being drawn with borders, therefore I think it is more representative of the applet.  You can create pull requests for translations alone without applet owners agreeing, so if you want, you can either close this and create a new pull request for the translation or revert changes to default values and screenshot in this pull request and then I will agree to it.

Name: sysmonitor@orcus: polish translation; new screenshot; new default settings

Name: IcingWindowSaver@json feature request
Comment_Body: Yeah, I actually have some changes I've been testing locally for a while, but haven't got around to committing - which is restoring  window stack order between restarts.  1. This is possible. Muffin also has a session restore feature that is currently disabled, I want to test that before doing any more extensive extension work in this area. 2. This can get tricky because Cinnamon can only preserve windows across restarts, not reboots, and it can't make too many assumptions. Still would be useful, but again I think we should dust off Muffin's forgotten session restorer and test it to see if it's worth salvaging.

Name: stopwatch applet: The configuration panel doesn't allows to add multiple instances
Comment_Body: @a-bentofreire Sorry I took so long but you did not put me as author in the issue comment so I only found it by chance. Issues do not automatically get to the author, a poor feature of Github.  Extra instances can be added from the Applets in the Control Centre (The + at the bottom of Manage Tab). The latest versions of Cinnamon do not offer adding and removing within Configure dialogue from the right click menu.   So what you are seeing is the expected behaviour and is Not an issue - it is a Feature of the new versions of Cinnamon. You reach the different instances from the arrows at the top. I agree that it is not such a convenient display but there is nothing I can do so can you please close the issue.  I however need to update the image in the description and will do so at my next update.  I am not sure why you got an error message, I have not been able to replicate it under any version of Cinnamon including 4.2 and there have been no other reports. Have you seen it again? If you do it should be a different issue.

Name: stopwatch applet: The configuration panel doesn't allows to add multiple instances
Comment_Body: Hi, Thank you for the reply. After mutter for a while, I reproduce the solution.  Yes, it works but it's quite an awkward solution.  Regarding the error message, yes, I still see it using Cinnamon 4.0.10 which it's up to now the latest stable version. Cinnamon 4.2 is still in BETA. The stable version will be release soon.

Name: nvidiaprime@pdcurtis: not working Linux Mint 19.x series
Comment_Body: @kelebek333 I currently have no access to a machine using Optimus and will not for seversl months so unless you are in a position to suggest alternative tests to use of bbswitch and /proc/acpi/bbswitch to see if Nvidia-Prime is enabled I will have to just block use under 19.x. Just installing bbswitch may have not be sufficient or have other consequences under 19.x if Nvidia-Prime is in use although I know it works with Bumblebee under 19.x as that is what I use myself on my own Optimus machine.  There can not be many users of nvidiaprime@pdcurtis if nobody has noticed up till now.

Name: nvidiaprime@pdcurtis: not working Linux Mint 19.x series
Comment_Body: @pdcurtis ; yes, installation of bbswitch not necassarry on Linux Mint 19.x. Because in this version nvidia-prime does not use bbswitch. Most nvidia-prime users may be using the default applet, so the issue may not have been noticed. However, the extras in your applet are useful in my opinion. That's why I wanted to give feedback. Prime-select command in the default applet can be used to query which GPU is enabled.  https://github.com/linuxmint/nvidia-prime-applet/blob/master/usr/share/cinnamon/applets/nvidia-prime%40cinnamon.org/applet.js  Thank you very much for your effort.

Name: nvidiaprime@pdcurtis: not working Linux Mint 19.x series
Comment_Body: @kelebek333 Will have a look over the next few days and see if I can put something together for ypu to test.

Name: nvidiaprime@pdcurtis: not working Linux Mint 19.x series
Comment_Body: It looks possible to use code from https://github.com/linuxmint/nvidia-prime-applet/blob/master/usr/share/cinnamon/applets/nvidia-prime%40cinnamon.org/applet.js as @kelebek333  suggests but I am not happy about making fairly major changes 'blind' as I have no way to test them as I am using  Bubblebee on my only Optimus machine and nvidia-prime is incompatible.  I have therefore blocked use of the current  applet under Cinnamon 3.8 and higher using "cinnamon version'" in metadata.json .  I have also made it easy for anybody who is using nvidia-prime to modify the applet by using the multiversion facility to provide a framework for a 3.8+ version which they can test and provide via a Pull Request without affecting the current functioning under Mint 18.x.

Comment_Body: I was able to reproduce it consistently.   The problem might be in the refreshWeather function, because binding that to a button clickevent also freezes Cinnamon. ```javascript     this._currentWeatherLocation = new St.Button({       reactive: true,       label: '',     });      this._currentWeatherLocation.style_class = STYLE_LOCATION_LINK     this._currentWeatherLocation.connect(SIGNAL_CLICKED, Lang.bind(this, function() {       if (this._currentWeatherLocation.url == null) {         // Freezes cinnamon if this function called from here         //this.refreshWeather();       } else {         Gio.app_info_launch_default_for_uri(           this._currentWeatherLocation.url,           global.create_app_launch_context()         )       }     })); ```

Name: weather@mockturtl 2.1.0 freezes the whole screen when it's moved in panel edit mode
Comment_Body: I've got this issue too, however for me it actually hardlocks Cinnamon so hard that it then requires a 'killall **-9** cinnamon' to get Cinnamon killed so that I can relaunch Cinnamon and be on my merry way again, it won't even react to a SIGTERM signal anymore at that point and exit whatsoever. Not even CTRL+ALT+ESC works for me, and a 'cinnamon --replace' just returns the 'Another WM is running' warning in output.  I've also identified that Moving The Panel also triggers the hardlock while the applet is active.  UPDATE: This issue can be triggered with the moving of **any** applet or panel while this is running

Name: weather@mockturtl 2.1.0 freezes the whole screen when it's moved in panel edit mode
Comment_Body: Update: It has to do with how I'm using libsoup, digging into it now   Update: Problem solved. I was using synchronous Soup calls in async functions (what should've been fine to be honest), it freeze Cinnamon when the applet got reloaded.   Had to wrap the async Soup calls in a Promise so I can use await on them, I use that now. works fine. Will be included in the next update

Comment_Body: Started looking at the code. 1st Q to you: are you sure settings callbacks are supposed to return promises? I can't find anything about it in Cinnamon docs; my suspicion is that the return value is simply ignored. Hence no point in making them async -- nothing will be waiting for completion anyway. Comment_Body: Here's me with 3.2.7+serena...

Name: Weather@mockturtl 2.1.0 does not work below Cinnamon version 3.8
Comment_Body: @Gr3q - for the time being I'm stuck with this: ``` const darkSky = require("darkSky"); const openWeatherMap = require("openWeatherMap"); // Location lookup service const ipApi = require("ipApi"); ``` Looking Glass says: ``` error t=2019-02-01T19:25:54Z require is not defined ``` Is CommonJS `require()` one of those things that's been added in 3.6.x? Can't find much in the way of docs w/Google and definitely no time enough to read through Cinnamon code...

Name: Weather@mockturtl 2.1.0 does not work below Cinnamon version 3.8
Comment_Body: @MaxMotovilov It was added in 3.8. It was added because the CJS importer (the `imports` object getter) cannot reload a file once its loaded, Cinnamon has to be restarted. Files that are imported with require do reload when the applet does. All applets are loaded this way via promises initially.  I opened a PR that makes it a multi-version applet, so 2.0.1 is loaded for Cinnamon <3.8.

Name: Weather@mockturtl 2.1.0 does not work below Cinnamon version 3.8
Comment_Body: Well. I guess as far as I'm concerned not updating the applet would achieve the same thing. I was hoping to contribute a rewrite back to plain ole ES6, but there's not much I can do about `require()` -- except, I guess, inline the modules (which the code owner isn't likely to accept...)

Name: Weather@mockturtl 2.1.0 does not work below Cinnamon version 3.8
Comment_Body: @MaxMotovilov I've switched requires to this last night on my dev branch: ``` const AppletDir = imports.ui.appletManager.applets['weather@mockturtl']; const darkSky = AppletDir.darkSky; const openWeatherMap = AppletDir.openWeatherMap; // Location lookup service const ipApi = AppletDir.ipApi; ``` Instead of using modules.export, regular functions can reside in the other files. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22377521/52162049-13dad780-26c6-11e9-870e-4a4a96e4745e.png)  Check it out [here](https://github.com/Gr3q/cinnamon-spices-applets/tree/dev)

Name: Weather@mockturtl 2.1.0 does not work below Cinnamon version 3.8
Comment_Body: @MaxMotovilov I've had bit of time to look into it in a Linux Mint VM.   It was indeed freezing cinnamon because _httpsession.send_message is not async. It was working kinda fine in async functions but I had replaced it with the promisified async equivalent of it.  Here is the version with your changes in what is not crashing: https://github.com/Gr3q/cinnamon-spices-applets/tree/3.8-backport/weather%40mockturtl   the _httpsession.send_message functions are commented out for now.  There is a function named LoadPayloadAsync commented out in applet.js what wraps the _httpsession.queue_message. That needs to be used instead of the send_message.  Could you fork my repo and have a look if you can do something with that function I'd appreciate it.  Edit: I removed the free version of OpenWeatherMap and I forgot to include the premium key. I will add it some time tomorrow.

Comment_Body: Thank you for the report. I'll try to reproduce the problem. Also, can you tell me what version of libgtop you have?

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hello,  thanks for looking into this! I got the one 2.38.0-2ubuntu0.18.04.1: https://packages.ubuntu.com/bionic-updates/libgtop-2.0-11 According to release notes this has been around for some time (I update my system every other week).  Thank you - and thanks to @jaszhix for mentioning.  Attached the current config of this system (./.cinnamon/configs/sysmonitor@orcus/28.json - renamed to txt)  [28.txt](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/files/2805360/28.txt)

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: I think I've fixed the issue.  There was [a bug](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/gjs/commit/19e899cd5008c2a00785769dc0ba2564d8447fe1) a few years ago in Gnome Shell, where used memory would grow with use. It was caused by SpiderMonkey's GC not freeing cairo contexts (and associated cairo surfaces) after dispose(), and I use cairo for drawing in my applet. To fix the issue, the function $dispose() was added to GJS (and thus CJS) to explicitly dispose of cairo surfaces.  I've installed Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS with Cinnamon to a VM and was able to reproduce the issue. Exactly as you say, each repaint increased memory usage and it was worse with faster refresh rate and/or larger applet area. I now manually dispose of cairo context after each repaint, let it run over night (at least 10 hours) with an applet as large as 1 panel and used memory by Cinnamon was still at 250 MB, more or less the same as after reboot.  Could you test if the changes work for you as well (and this was indeed the same issue you have) before I make a pull request? Replace `~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/sysmonitor@orcus/3.2/graph.js` with [https://github.com/OrcusCZ/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/sysmon-memoryleak-fix/sysmonitor%40orcus/files/sysmonitor%40orcus/3.2/graph.js](https://github.com/OrcusCZ/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/sysmon-memoryleak-fix/sysmonitor%40orcus/files/sysmonitor%40orcus/3.2/graph.js)

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Sounds good. I'll be testing this on both machines, just in case; tomorrow night I'll be reporting back. Thank you for the quick response and the work in general.

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hello, earlier than expected. The RAM looks good on both machines, just watched for around 2 hours. This machine was restarted, the other had only cinnamon restarted. It seems that CPU load is a little higher than before also worse when the updates are faster. I tried to capture this in a screenhistory from the gnome system monitor but it seems to be just an subjective average; difficult to show. I'll check in tomorrow again with the load experience on these machines.

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hello, sorry I couldn't get back yesterday. The RAM usage is fine. I had yesterday on the e7480 a usage of +500MB after an uptime of 36 hours. Now with uptime of 6hours I got 300MB. That would be OK. But as I said I monitored the CPU load seems to be higher a little in average. The cpu time was recorded as top consumer over the 36hour period with around 8hours (says htop). With current 6h uptime cinnamon is recorded with 2.5hours of cpu time. Is that related to the context discard for every cycle?  Thank you.

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hi, I'll look into it. The only change I did was that I now manually call $dispose() at the end of repaint event, so cairo surfaces are properly freed (the same fix as used in [this extension](https://github.com/paradoxxxzero/gnome-shell-system-monitor-applet/commit/19a382d50265c06ff20b393b2122f0cf73902e67)), so the only thing that could increase CPU usage compared to the current applet version is explicit destroying of cairo context.  If it really comes from that, not sure what to do to avoid both increased RAM and CPU usage. If I understand the problem right, GC won't collect cairo surfaces, I have to explicitly call $dispose() every time I use cairo context, so I can't call it with lower frequency. Maybe I could use only 1 drawing area for the whole applet. Right now, each graph uses its own drawing area, because it simplifies the code for drawing and enabling / disabling specific graphs. I'll change the code to use only 1 drawing area and test if it helps.

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hello,  Don't know if it helps; for years I used the simple iceWM that is  displaying ram as fixed bar in the middle and cpu+netload in variable  length around it. Works similar but has some display bugs. Cinnamon goes better on a laptop  for intuitive use, navigation is better and I need the  gnome-online-accounts for Microsoft exchange. That WMs code might be giving ideas, even the language is different. But even if it doesn't, more CPU is still better than ram load :)

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hi, I've changed the applet code to use only one drawing area, so if the higher CPU usage comes from $dispose(), it should be better now.  I didn't notice any significant CPU usage increase with my previous fix, but I've tested it only on one device and it was VM, because I don't use Ubuntu and wanted to test the same environment as you have. I'll most likely update the applet to this new version after I do some more testing and check if everything works.  You can try it and check if you have lower CPU usage with this new version. It's available currently in my fork here [https://github.com/OrcusCZ/cinnamon-spices-applets/tree/sysmon-memoryleak-fix/sysmonitor%40orcus/files/sysmonitor%40orcus/3.2](https://github.com/OrcusCZ/cinnamon-spices-applets/tree/sysmon-memoryleak-fix/sysmonitor%40orcus/files/sysmonitor%40orcus/3.2), you should update all changed files (or all files just to be sure).

Until the middle 80px bar seems like  it would not fully disappear. I'm attaching the small bar screenshot.  Hope it helps.  Thank you!  ![sysmon_bar](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13560529/52237634-61279680-28ca-11e9-8e3a-8c289b8b7f33.png)

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use

It should be in the directory `~/.cinnamon/configs/sysmonitor@orcus`. I didn't see this behavior in my environment and maybe it is something in your config which leads to it and allows me to replicate it. Thanks

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hi OrcuCZ,  I did replace the applet, graph and settings-schema as those were the changed files and overwrote files in ~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/sysmonitor@orcus/3.2/ That should be OK, I believe. I crosschecked since it was late. But it is late again ;) The settings are attached "28.json" (renamed from 28.json)  Thank you.  [28.txt](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/files/2834059/28.txt)

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hi, I think I got it. You have disabled swap, right? From the colors, it looked like swap graph was causing the problem and I found that if I disable swap, I get NaN as a value to plot (used / total = 0 / 0 with disabled swap, division by zero). And the resulting behavior was exactly the same as yours. I changed only one file [https://github.com/OrcusCZ/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/8d5b70ab6e7d40cfb19355635f2bd868b3284475/sysmonitor%40orcus/files/sysmonitor%40orcus/3.2/providers.js](https://github.com/OrcusCZ/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/8d5b70ab6e7d40cfb19355635f2bd868b3284475/sysmonitor%40orcus/files/sysmonitor%40orcus/3.2/providers.js). I hope this fixes your issue, and if it does, could you please check your CPU usage, if it is better than the first version with fixed memory leak?

Name: Increased RAM usage while applet sysmonitor@orcus in use
Comment_Body: Hello,  sorry, I've been busy with work; I'm testing it now locally and it looks good for some minutes. I'll check tomorrow with working laptop and run it for the whole day.  Yes I don't use swap normally.  Thank you!

I disabled them, load is down to around 15-20%; So the drawing is causing the CPU load, in my case 10x per second, but I don't think that this can be changed without rewriting the code. Most people won't need the fast redraw. Behaviour is the same on both of my machines. So I'd think this issue #2253 (RAM) is resolved nevertheless. Display also looks fine. If you need something from me, please let me know. Otherwise you or I can close #2253.  Thank you for all your effort and the great plugin. I need this. If it wasn't there, I'd need to dump the optics and features of Cinnamon and go back to iceWM.

Name: weather@mockturtl fails to update 2.0.0 - CLOSE
Comment_Body: I maybe mistaken, now it seems to be updating but about 1 1/2 hours behind. Doubt that this would be the app. At the openweathermap.org site shows temp for my location 36 degrees F. App shows 33 with update. Weather.com shows 37.  I will observe this a bit more and probably close if I do not discover more.

Name: weather@mockturtl fails to update 2.0.0 - CLOSE
Comment_Body: You are wrong. I've added some log lines and can confirm the applet works as expected. It's not mandatory temperature to be changed in "_5 update cycles_"...

Name: weather@mockturtl fails to update 2.0.0 - CLOSE
Comment_Body: I'm sure you are right. But you missed the point about 5 update cycles. I was just giving it long enough to update and it wasn't. Yesterday it never updated, but perhaps I was not waiting long enough before manually updating. To day (with update set to 15 minutes) the temp was rising rapidly. It was 10:30 before it showed the 9 am temp. Now in the afternoon the temp is more stable and not changing as rapidly. But late morning I changed from 15 minute interval to 5 minute and it is doing much better. But that change should not have mattered. Probably because the temp is now more stable it seems more accurate. But also if most of my update request were being rejected it would seem slower to update. By changing to 5 minutes I am making 3x as many request so that might be it.  Not sure to tell if my request are being rejected.  But since no one else has a concern it must be me. I will **close.**

Name: weather@mockturtl fails to update 2.0.0 - CLOSE
Comment_Body: @benchrest You might be right, but for a different reason.  What I think happened that the Applet threw an exception silently what broke the main refresh loop. (No try/catch wrap around it atm, but it really really should).  When that happens, the loop won't come back. Change in the settings kicks off a refresh once.  I will definitely fix exception handling in the next update along with logging, along with some things actually visible to the users as well.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: Using `diff --suppress-common-lines open_download_tab.py /usr/share/cinnamon/cinnamon-settings/cinnamon-settings.py`: ``` 2,4d1 < # This is a palimpsest of /usr/share/cinnamon/cinnamon-settings/cinnamon-settings.py (Cinnamon 4.0.9) < # made to open the Download tab with spices sorted by date. < # Usage: ~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/SpicesUpdate@claudiux/scripts/open_download_tab.py applets|desklets|extensions|themes 17d13 < sys.path.append("/usr/share/cinnamon/cinnamon-settings") 143,148c139 <                     if len(l) > 1: # claudiux <                         sidePage.stack.set_visible_child(l[1]) # claudiux <                         sidePage.stack.get_visible_child().sort_combo.set_active(2) <                         sidePage.stack.get_visible_child().sort_changed() <                     else: # claudiux <                         sidePage.stack.set_visible_child(l[0]) --- >                     sidePage.stack.set_visible_child(l[0]) ```

Comment_Body: I'm not sure forking parts of Cinnamon is the best solution here. Why not PR a change in cinnamon so the settings pages can be controlled from the cli?

Comment_Body: That's my intention. But these changes in Cinnamon will only be valid in v4.2, it seems to me?  This PR is only a transient solution to solve the issue #2230.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: @jaszhix PR made: https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/8333

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: Cool. I just think its a drastic step for a minor inconvenience to the user. E.g., you'd have to maintain a core part of Cinnamon in your extension.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: It does not scare me. ;)  And I can make this applet multi-version.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: Hi @jaszhix,  Could you merge this PR with your master branch, please?

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: I don't think this should be merged in its current state. If more applets start borrowing and re-purposing cinnamon components to get features out quicker it can become a maintenance burden when bugs are found in cinnamon.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: Well, there's nothing wrong with adding the ability to open a particular tab and follow a particular sorting order in cinnamon-settings. We can do that in 4.2. I'm not sure I like the way the arguments are defined (1, 2, etc... that's not very explicit, but anyway that's a detail).  Once that's done, from a an applet dev point of view, you need to accept that this feature is only present in 4.2 onward and not before. The applet can have a 4.2 dir and behave differently from that version on.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: @clefebvre @jaszhix Is it now acceptable? The latest changes no longer require any changes in `/usr/share/cinnamon/cinnamon-settings/cinnamon-settings.py` and result in easier maintenance of this applet.  I can also close https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/8333 or modify it to change parameters in --tab=1 --sort=2.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: Yeah, LGTM. Just to clarify, I was only talking about this PR in particular. I understand where you're coming from, and don't blame you for wanting to add it in there.

Name: SpicesUpdate@claudiux: v1.2.0 - Fixes #2230
Comment_Body: Many thanks @jaszhix !  I should have offered this code immediately. I admit to having wanted to go faster, without thinking too much. It was you who were right.

Name: weather@mockturtl: Weather details fail to load (expired API?)
Comment_Body: Looks like project WOEID has been discontinued:   > Important EOL Notice: As of Thursday, Jan. 3, 2019, the weather.yahooapis.com and query.yahooapis.com for Yahoo Weather API will be retired.  >To continue using our free Yahoo Weather APIs, use https://weather-ydn-yql.media.yahoo.com/forecastrss. Contact yahoo-weather-ydn-api@oath.com for credentials to onboard to this free Yahoo Weather API service. >https://developer.yahoo.com/weather/  After Verizon acquired Yahoo!, this has been happening to a lot of their open APIs.  I've been looking for an alternative and there seems to be a few of them but they all require that a user create an account with them and get an API key. There's also an option to scrape websites for temp/weather forecast data.  Some alternatives that we could use to replace Yahoo:    - https://darksky.net/dev - 1000 calls per day for free, requires an API key & registration.   - https://openweathermap.org/price - don't let that word 'open' and '.org' fool you.. you still need an API key and you get a 5 day forecast   - https://www.apixu.com/ - need an API key + registration; limited number of requests   - https://www.foreca.com/ - I found this after I snooped on Windows 10's weather app in a VM. It's using this service. It's actually one of the most comprehensive weather solutions (i.e. https://www.foreca.com/United_States/California/Oakland ) but I don't see an API so scarping would be the only solution... but as a benefit, you wouldn't need to register.    - http://wttr.in/ - weather on a command line: `curl http://wttr.in/oakland` would have to be scraped; no idea about the source of the data.  Anyway, it looks like the new widget will have to be a bit more complicated. :)

Name: weather@mockturtl: Weather details fail to load (expired API?)
Comment_Body: I've used, and am using again while this issue is still open, a cli program called ansiweather, which utilizes OpenWeatherMap. They were able to get an API key specifically for the program so that individual users don't need to register for a key themselves. OpenWeatherMap allows FOSS programs to do this:  https://github.com/fcambus/ansiweather/issues/82  I can get a 7 day forecast with it.

Name: weather@mockturtl: Weather details fail to load (expired API?)
Comment_Body: From https://developer.yahoo.com/weather/  "Important EOL Notice: As of Thursday, Jan. 3, 2019, the weather.yahooapis.com and query.yahooapis.com for Yahoo Weather API will be retired.   To continue using our free Yahoo Weather APIs, use https://weather-ydn-yql.media.yahoo.com/forecastrss. Contact yahoo-weather-ydn-api@oath.com for credentials to onboard to this free Yahoo Weather API service. "

Name: weather@mockturtl: Weather details fail to load (expired API?)
Comment_Body: I started to work on the applet to use OpenWeatherMap in a way that it could be extended to support more APIs (or BBC) later on.   I'm really busy too, but i will try to get it working this weekend, maybe get a pull request up next week. (Actually I don't really know if I'm allowed to do that but I will work on it nevertheless)  Edit: OpenWeatherMap is working, I will do the forecasts tomorrow. Regressions so far: Wind Chill is not in this API, Location is not a button anymore (could refer to a static address later, API does not include it).

Name: weather@mockturtl: Weather details fail to load (expired API?)
Comment_Body: > I started to work on the applet to use OpenWeatherMap in a way that it could be extended to support more APIs (or BBC) later on. >  > I'm really busy too, but i will try to get it working this weekend, maybe get a pull request up next week. (Actually I don't really know if I'm allowed to do that but I will work on it nevertheless)  Excellent news !! Mint puts you in its distribution, it is a duty on your part to honor the trust they place in you. In 7-8 years it is the 2nd major breakdown. Already last time you took too much time to solve problems. I hope that if a problem should happen again in the future you will react more quickly. If you need it, looking for someone to take over the project and take care as if it were her baby :) Excellent year 2019 to all of you, happiness and well being to you.

Name: weather@mockturtl: Weather details fail to load (expired API?)
Comment_Body: > Mint puts you in its distribution, it is a duty on your part to honor the trust they place in you. In 7-8 years it is the 2nd major breakdown. Already last time you took too much time to solve problems.  For [most of the project's history](https://github.com/mockturtl/cinnamon-weather/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#i-have-a-feature-request-or-code-changes), I kept a disclaimer: _"I can't guarantee I will respond to these issues promptly, or ever. Feel free to @mention me in the issue comments if too much time has passed."_  Spices developers are volunteers, and it's a non-transferable skill.  Try not to take their time for granted.

Name: weather@mockturtl: Weather details fail to load (expired API?)

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: Nothing more to add. Happy Holidays to you, @jaszhix, the team and all the contributors !

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: To test this applet, just modify the "last-edited" field in the metadata.json file of some Spices. (I subtract 3000000 seconds.)

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: Personally, I think it's a bad idea to have this as a 3rd party applet. The reason is that, as a 3rd party applet, we could potentially have multiple versions of the applet with multiple versions of Cinnamon, and so if we change something about the way applets are installed, etc (this does happen from time to time), it could potentially break something for the user which wouldn't be fixed by removing the applet.  Also, as @jaszhix mentioned, that script is not intended to be used by anyone but applet (et al) developers who wish to test their code without actually pushing their changes and waiting for it to be merged.  I would much rather see a stock Cinnamon applet, which uses Spices.py directly for all spices stuff. Such an applet would ideally do all the heavy lifting in python (where we already have all the necessary functions in one place), and then communicate status, commands, and notifications via dbus. This will be much easier to maintain, and also ensure that the version that users have always matches their version of Cinnamon. Plus it will help cut down on spurious and hard to track bug reports that might arise.

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: Hi @jaszhix,  Many thanks for your tests and your comments and suggestions. This applet is the result of several months of reflection and work. I hope it will be well received and that Cinnamon users will find it useful.  Happy New Year 2019 !

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: @claudiux I think I agree with @collinss here. I appreciate the effort you put into this - I've attempted this myself once, but had to put it on the back burner.  Do you think it would be possible to re-purpose this into a Cinnamon PR? I think extension management should be handled by Cinnamon.

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: I've actually started working on something myself. I'd been meaning to do it for a while (pretty much since the rework of the extension settings), but our conversation got me to thinking, so I started experimenting. I'll let you know if I get anywhere with it so you don't waste any more time on it needlessly.

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: OK @jaszhix, I will do two things:    * encode a "light" version of this applet, renamed "SpicesUpdate", which will only monitor updates;   * encode a Cinnamon version, in python, using Spices.py (my first idea, in facts).  Is there a way to directly open the "Download" tab, for example in `cinnamon-settings applets`, in javascript (for applet) and in python?

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: Yeah, if it's just notifying about updates that is probably a fair compromise. As for Spices.py, I'm not sure. @collinss usually works in that area.

Name: SpicesUpdater@claudiux - Checks and automatically updates your Spices
Comment_Body: Ok, I let @collinss work in his area ;) and I will propose an applet to just notify about updates. I close this PR.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Custom menu entries are being held on to after uninstall
Comment_Body: The menu editor is a core part of Cinnamon. Cinnamenu only provides a shortcut to launch it. Making changes with it modifies the contents of ~/.local/share/applications and  ~/.config/menus which apply to all freedesktop compliant menus.  See https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/tree/master/files/etc/xdg/menus & https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/tree/master/files/usr/share/cinnamon/cinnamon-menu-editor

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Custom menu entries are being held on to after uninstall
Comment_Body: @smurphos Thanks for the heads up. I'll test it out again with this in mind.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Custom menu entries are being held on to after uninstall
Comment_Body: The menu editor is not a part of Cinnamenu.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Unknown entry appearing in the list
Comment_Body: The wine-wine category is set here as far as I know - https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/blob/master/files/etc/xdg/menus/cinnamon-applications.menu  It appears in the menu-editor irrespective of which menu you are using.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Unknown entry appearing in the list
Comment_Body: @smurphos Do you think it should be hidden or removed from the Configure list? I don't think it should be too hard to not display it and leaving it there would only confuse a user.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Unknown entry appearing in the list
Comment_Body: The menu editor is not a part of Cinnamenu.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Menu editor is not adding custom entries
Comment_Body: This is normal behaviour and applies equally to the stock menu.  Categories (user added or not) are not visible in the menu unless they contain at least one visible menu-item.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Menu editor is not adding custom entries
Comment_Body: @smurphos Thanks for the explanation. I'll test this out again and verify it works correctly.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Menu editor is not adding custom entries
Comment_Body: @smurphos is right, this is just how the menu editor works.

Name: temperature@fevimu Weird labels
Comment_Body: Which CPU model do you have?  Please attach the output you get when running the `sensors` command.

Name: temperature@fevimu Weird labels
Comment_Body: `$ sudo sensors`  iwlwifi-virtual-0 Adapter: Virtual device temp1:        +44.0°C    thinkpad-isa-0000 Adapter: ISA adapter fan1:           0 RPM  acpitz-virtual-0 Adapter: Virtual device temp1:        +47.0°C  (crit = +128.0°C)  coretemp-isa-0000 Adapter: ISA adapter Package id 0:  +48.0°C  (high = +100.0°C, crit = +100.0°C) Core 0:        +48.0°C  (high = +100.0°C, crit = +100.0°C) Core 1:        +47.0°C  (high = +100.0°C, crit = +100.0°C) Core 2:        +47.0°C  (high = +100.0°C, crit = +100.0°C) Core 3:        +47.0°C  (high = +100.0°C, crit = +100.0°C)  pch_skylake-virtual-0 Adapter: Virtual device temp1:        +47.5°C

Name: temperature@fevimu Weird labels
Comment_Body: This is working as it should. Its displaying data from the sensors command. If that's not correct, it would suggest a configuration issue. ~Maybe hyper threading isn't enabled in the bios?~ Actually, this is an important distinction, is it 8 physical cores? It can only show the temperature of those.  You could try running `sudo sensors-detect`, and let it amend your modules file and reboot.  Anyway, this can't be fixed in the applet, sorry.

Name: temperature@fevimu Weird labels
Comment_Body: Ok, thanks for the explanation.  I was just confused because it's called CPU temperature but displays other virtual devices temperatures.

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis - update stylesheet.css to look like other applets
Comment_Body: This stylesheet.css was identical to the stylesheet.css files in folder 3.2 and in the base folder. I didn't know if I should change them all.

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis - update stylesheet.css to look like other applets
Comment_Body: Make sure you ping the maintainer @pdcurtis.

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis - update stylesheet.css to look like other applets
Comment_Body: Hey @pdcurtis,  what do you think about the changes? Would you be so kind to test them? Regards.

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis - update stylesheet.css to look like other applets
Comment_Body: I will certainly have a look but it will be a few days.  There was a logic to avoid the defaults and it would also affect some of my other applets so changes need a lot of consideration  That is why I gave the option for users to edit the style sheet under advanced options. The problem is that they are overwritten by updates and I will more likely look at a way to give persistence to edits.  @jaszhix Can you put a tag such as discussion or WIP on this and I would be interested if there is any policy on styling of applets

And after each update (which you do very often, thanks) my changes are gone. Persistence to edits is a good idea, but I don't know if that fits in the applet update philosophy.

If you are interested in working with applets the best source of information is to load `cinnamon-doc` which should pull in `devhelp` which will put Devhelp in the menu and give access to the latest (but not perfect!) documentation which will explain why there is an applet.js etc in subfolders like 3.2 and 4.0 for different cinnamon versions. There is information, (a bit behind) on my applets on www.pcurtis.com/spices.htm and my personal use of git and Github  for applets at www.pcurtis.com/git.htm

Name: "xampp-panel@backids99" applet doesn't work because GKSUDO doesn't exists anymore
Comment_Body: I confirm this bug. I did know about this before. I did try to recreate the commands of original applet to use with pkexec but applet do not work correctly still. I am failed because my knowledge of developing applets for cinnamon desktop is not extensive enough. Here are original commands: ``` //applet command constants var CommandConstants = new function() {     this.COMMAND_START_XAMPP = "gksudo /opt/lampp/lampp start";     this.COMMAND_STOP_XAMPP = "gksudo /opt/lampp/lampp stop";     this.COMMAND_RESTART_XAMPP = "gksudo /opt/lampp/lampp restart";     this.COMMAND_PHP_CONFIG_EDIT = "gksudo xdg-open /opt/lampp/etc/php.ini";     this.COMMAND_LAUNCH_PHPMYADMIN = "xdg-open http://localhost/phpmyadmin/";     this.COMMAND_LAUNCH_WEBDIR = "xdg-open http://localhost/";     this.COMMAND_OPEN_WEBDIR = "nemo /opt/lampp/htdocs/"; } ``` and here are 'my' commands: ``` //applet command constants var CommandConstants = new function() {     this.COMMAND_START_LINUX_MANAGER = "pkexec env DISPLAY=$DISPLAY XAUTHORITY=$XAUTHORITY /opt/lampp/manager-linux-x64.run";     this.COMMAND_START_XAMPP = "pkexec env DISPLAY=$DISPLAY XAUTHORITY=$XAUTHORITY /opt/lampp/lampp start";     this.COMMAND_STOP_XAMPP = "pkexec env DISPLAY=$DISPLAY XAUTHORITY=$XAUTHORITY /opt/lampp/lampp stop";     this.COMMAND_RESTART_XAMPP = "pkexec env DISPLAY=$DISPLAY XAUTHORITY=$XAUTHORITY /opt/lampp/lampp restart";     this.COMMAND_PHP_CONFIG_EDIT = "xed admin:///opt/lampp/etc/php.ini"; //It works!     this.COMMAND_LAUNCH_PHPMYADMIN = "xdg-open http://localhost/phpmyadmin/";     this.COMMAND_LAUNCH_WEBDIR = "xdg-open http://localhost/";     this.COMMAND_OPEN_WEBDIR = "nemo /opt/lampp/htdocs/"; } ``` This applet of cinnamon do not have an error, pkexec just do not show dialog, which I can enter password. When I execute command in terminal, then dialog is display.  When I run commands by applet, nothing is happened.

Name: IcingTaskManager@json: Add migration functionality for moving pinned apps from ITM to GWL
Comment_Body: @jaszhix I am sure this is not the correct place but from what I have found so far your IcingTaskManager is currently much better than the GWL in Cinnamon 4.03 which is missing some of the functionality and customization I use. I immediately switched back and hope you will continue to support what I have always felt has been the most important applet and the first one I install, even ahead of my own!

Name: IcingTaskManager@json: Add migration functionality for moving pinned apps from ITM to GWL
Comment_Body: @pdcurtis What features in particular do you want to see in GWL?  I was originally going to copy and rename GWL as ITM for Cinnamon 4, but I think that would be seen as removing things, which I don't want to do. GWL is a lot more polished and refined, has less bugs, and its easier for me to help maintain one window list applet that more people use and contribute to, than two with varying features. The two applets have diverged a lot.  It wouldn't be impossible to back-port the bug fixes, and refinements - but I would rather help maintain one window list applet, and patch the things people are missing in ITM for Cinnamon 4.2. I'll leave this open for a while to see if more people prefer ITM because I don't want to limit people's options prematurely.

Name: IcingTaskManager@json: Add migration functionality for moving pinned apps from ITM to GWL
Comment_Body: @jaszhix What I noticed immediately was that the identification of what windows were active and how many duplicate windows were in use was different. I think what I use was set by Number Display where I use setting normal which only puts a superscript number on windows that are in use but shows how many whilst highlighting (depending on theme) shows the window in focus. Currently I have 13 different programs running some with up to 4 instances and the ITM makes it very easy.   Overall it looks as if quite a few options were dropped.   Also the icons seem to be much smaller and have odd bars on the bottom on several themes and no indication which window is in focus. It may be I am running with an early copy.   Some of the options may be confusing to a new user but perhaps they could be hidden or on an advanced tab - I am sure you added them all for very good reasons.

Name: IcingTaskManager@json: Add migration functionality for moving pinned apps from ITM to GWL
Comment_Body: What theme are you using? GWL relies on new class names so it doesn't conflict with other styles, and not all themes are compatible yet. This was done so the theme options could be dropped because they were buggy in some themes and hard to support. I would still get rid of them if I were to  continue ITM development - this is a transitional issue for theme maintainers.

I have done an update and there seems to be some improvements in GWL / Themes interaction.

I can now see on some of the themes what is supposed to happen but I still think that options on the way the superscript numbers are displayed is useful as it gives a very good way to separate between a pinned, in use and multiple in use programs which is consistent between themes. All the JS comments turn into API docs, and viewable through the app. We can't always document everything, and you should definitely read the parts of Cinnamon's source you're interested in, its like flying blind otherwise.
