Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: @pdcurtis Both network applets load fine on 4.0. I would move the applet files in files/UUID/ to its own version directory though, I think Cinnamon will ignore them if `multiversion` is enabled in metadata.json. Directory should be the lowest cinnamon version number they will support.

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: @jaszhix Thanks for the quick response but I am once more confused. That does not seem to be what the only actual  documentation I could find at http://developer.linuxmint.com/reference/git/cinnamon-tutorials/xlet-versioning.html says about where earlier versions should live. To quote:  > To enable extension versioning, extensions have to add the line >  > { >       "multiversion": true > } >  > in metadata.json. The different versions should be put in different subdirectories. For example, the version for 2.6 should be put in `extension@uuid/2.6/`. The contents in 2.6/ should be exactly what you will normally put in `extension@uuid/`, apart from metadata.json, which should always be put in the parent directory, ie. `extension@uuid/`. >  > You do not need to create a subdirectory for every single Cinnamon version out there. Cinnamon looks for the most recent subdirectory that is not newer than the running Cinnamon version. For example, if you are running 2.6 and there are 2.4, 2.8 directories, the 2.4 directory will be loaded, until the you upgrade to 2.8 in which case the 2.8 directory will be used. Minor version numbers can also be used, eg. 2.6.4, and are sorted accordingly. >  > If no suitable directory is found, then the contents in `extension@uuid/` will be loaded. Note that Cinnamon versions prior to 2.6 will not understand this directory magic, and will always try to load the contents in `extension@uuid/`. **Hence it is suggested that extension maintainers put the version for 2.4 in extension@uuid, and create new directories if changes specific to newer Cinnamon versions are made.** Don’t make a new directory whenever a Cinnamon version is out since it is just a waste of space (and maintenance effort). >   I also looked at several other applets before I started. The system seems to be very tolerant and one only seemed to have the changed files in the x.y folder but most seemed to follow the above. Your applets however work with nothing in `extension@uuid/`  The applets also work fine on my Mint 19 system so Cinnamon is not ignoring them with `multiversion`  enabled in metadata.json and are supported back to 2.2 which came with LTS version 17 which is current until some time in 2019.  Do you have some more up to date documentation that I have not found?

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: @jaszhix Another question. I have noticed in https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/wiki/%5Bdevelopment%5D-extensions that `metadata.json` has:  ```     requiredProperties: ['uuid', 'name', 'description', 'cinnamon-version'],     niceToHaveProperties: ['url'], ``` Is this the case as it means every applet would need `cinnamon-version` to be updated every time the cinnamon version is changed and hundreds of PRs?  It also means I should add it  `cinnamon-version` to `metadata.json` in all my applets next time they are updated!

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: Most of that documentation and examples of other applets you're seeing were from before I refactored the extension system. Mint 19 has the new bindings so you wouldn't be able to tell if the legacy version or the 4.0 version is working, did you try logging to see if the file you thought was loaded was loaded?  You can specify the cinnamon version if you want to, you don't really need to if you have the versions taken care of with directories. I haven't made note of the exact behavior of how this works recently, my suggestion to you would be to experiment, which is often times what I do to learn more about how the system works. Keep in mind a lot of this documentation is old and the code is always changing. Even if it wasn't required to use a version directory for every version fork, I would recommend doing it anyway because it looks a lot clearer what files are for which version.

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: As far as I can tell the files that are being used are what I expect, for example the help and log files have the correct contents. There is a BUT as I am not loading as such but have a symbolic links to the git repository so any changes automatically update for testing as I change branches eg by:  `ln -s ~/cinnamon-spices-applets/netusagemonitor@pdcurtis/files/netusagemonitor@pdcurtis ~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/netusagemonitor@pdcurtis`  I will do some further tests and experiments in another branch as you suggest including adding some test code outputting to the system log files but I am pretty sure that I am running the code I expect under Mint 19 and you found it worked under Cinnamon 4.0  I can however see problems coming if even those at the heart of Cinnamon need to run experiments and when we have 148 applets which may need to be checked and potentially updated even in a trivial manner for every version - that's potentially a lot of PRs.  Would you like me to also take on netusage@30yavash.com - I have already done quite a bit of work on it in the past and keep it on my installed on my desktop and I obviously have a fork of the desklet repository.  I can make the same changes as the two I am already doing - when I know what they should be!

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: If you want to maintain it, sure - I mainly got the desklet to not crash Cinnamon, but there may be other issues with it using the new NM API.  If you want me to merge this, I will - what I'm saying in this discussion is more along the lines of advice.

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: I will take on netusage@30yavash.com and test it out and fix the problem with filling error logs when no connection is present. I will also use it as a test bed for some of the other points you have raised before we merge them all.  As a first input I have done a search with grep and there are only 13 of 148 applets which use `'cinnamon-version'` in `metadata.json` and quite a few already have `"4.0"` included. There are also several which do not get to `"3.8"` so that updating is a much smaller task than I feared. It is also clear that a `'cinnamon-version'` is not obligatory.

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: @jaszhix I  have now looked at all the applets which either use  `cinnamon-version` (13) or `multiversion` (14) and they mostly overlap and I have assumed most of them work although I have put emphasis on those from those from authors I know about.  I have run tests:  1.  to make sure that `cinnamon-version` does prevent loading of applets and shows it in error log in Looking Glass.  2. to make sure that  applets load from default position of  `extension@uuid/` as well as from folders  I am assuming one should cover back to LTS 17.x for the next 6 months (until 19.2) although users numbers of 17.x are likely to be small.  Some conclusions are:  - If support does not extend back over the currently supported  LTSs then `cinnamon-version` is essential regardless of whether `multiversion` is in use.  - One should currently use `cinnamon-version` to provide the first version supported or one should have the contents in `extension@uuid/` as there is no mechanism to support `multiversion` until cinnamon 2.6. Examples of the contents in `extension@uuid/` from better known players include `sticky@scollins` and `searchbox@mtwebster`.  - Once LTS 17 has dropped out of support at 19.2 and if `multiversion` is needed then having a 2.6 folder and nothing in `extension@uuid/` will be preferable and more clear.    - Likewise use of `cinnamon-version` when `multiversion` is in use is good practice (although it currently does not seem to be essential).   - If the use of `cinnamon-version` increases then there are advantages in keeping it to a single line so a find and replace can be used to automatically update all the applets as cinnamon versions increment.  So my current plan is to:  -  Add a  `cinnamon-version` to the applets here via an extra commit and leave the code in  in `extension@uuid/`  When Mint 19.2/Cinnamon 4.2 becomes available  - Move the code for early versions from to a 2.6 folder from `extension@uuid/`

Name: netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.6 (multiversion to support Cinnamon 4.0)
Comment_Body: @jaszhix  Pushed changes as above. It is currently 3 commits - last two could be combined but the initial two are best separate so diff of changes in  4.0 from earlier version is more clear.  I see no reason why it can not be merged so I will taken the WIP off   Thank you for the enormous amount of effort you have been putting into this latest release. Please and let me know if there is anything I can do to help.

Name: Back-up State: Issues under LinuxMint 19.
Comment_Body: Patch below, if you want it.  ``` --- backup.original	2018-11-21 12:45:28.804121771 -0500 +++ back-up_state@natsakis.com/applet.js	2018-11-21 13:21:48.648534283 -0500 @@ -16,7 +16,7 @@  }    function logError(error) { -    global.logError(UUID + '#' + logError.caller.name + ': ' + error); +    global.logError(UUID + ': ' + error);  }    function main(metadata, orientation, instance_id) { @@ -61,8 +61,8 @@              this.set_applet_tooltip(_("Has never run succesfully!"));            }            else { -            shortDate = new Date(this._findDate()); -            longDate = new Date(this._findDate()); +            let shortDate = new Date(this._findDate()); +            let longDate = new Date(this._findDate());              shortDate.setDate(shortDate.getDate() + this._opt_warningDays);              longDate.setDate(longDate.getDate() + this._opt_errorDays);              if (longDate < new Date()) { @@ -83,7 +83,7 @@      },            _searchStringInArray: function (str, strArray) { -      k = null; +      let k = null;        for (var j=0; j<strArray.length; j++) {            if (strArray[j].match(str)) k = j;        } @@ -92,9 +92,9 @@            _findDate: function () {          try { -          let logs = Cinnamon.get_file_contents_utf8_sync(this._opt_logFile); +          let logs = Cinnamon.get_file_contents_utf8_sync(this._opt_logFile.replace(/^(file:\/\/)/, ''));            let lines = logs.split('\n'); -          index = this._searchStringInArray(this._opt_idString,lines); +          let index = this._searchStringInArray(this._opt_idString,lines);                        if (index == null) {              return _("Has never run successfully!"); ```

Name: [multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23] 1.8.7 crashes Cinnamon

Name: Cinnamenu bug - Under Mint 19/grid view there is no app right-click context menu, unable to add to favorites
Comment_Body: Hi @Sven71, I loaded Cinnamenu in a fresh Mint 19 VM with Cinnamon 3.8, and unable to reproduce the context menu not appearing. Before doing anything, make sure Cinnamenu is up to date in Settings -> Applets.  If that doesn't resolve the issue, please provide the info requested in the [issue template](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/master/.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE).

Name: Cinnamenu bug - Under Mint 19/grid view there is no app right-click context menu, unable to add to favorites
Comment_Body: Hi @jaszhix , updated everything. * Cinnamenu ver. 4.0.0 (installed via Mint applet installer app) * Cinnamon version 3.8.9 * Distribution Linux Mint 19 Cinnamon 64bit * Graphics hardware Intel Corporation 3rd Gen Core processor Graphics Controller  Experimented a little now and noticed that the context menu becomes unavailable when custom height is switched ON and increased so it comes close (5px) to the screen edge. Funny thing, that's exactly how I had it. Right, just my luck.  Hope that bit of info helps.

Name: Cinnamenu bug - Under Mint 19/grid view there is no app right-click context menu, unable to add to favorites
Comment_Body: @Sven71 What cinnamon desktop theme are you using? Can you reproduce the issue with the default Cinnamon theme?

Name: Cinnamenu bug - Under Mint 19/grid view there is no app right-click context menu, unable to add to favorites
Comment_Body: Hi Steve! I'm actually using OSX-Arc-Darker theme. Tried with default theme, the ability to use context menu disappears 2px from the edge of the screen, so yes, it's theme-dependent :)  Feels like the system is drawing some kind of a transparent frame all around the menu beyond which some weird stuff begins to happen. As for me personally, once I figured out the behavior (thanks for the tips guys!) it stopped being a problem for me, I just keep the menu a bit farther from the edge that's all.

Name: Cinnamenu bug - Under Mint 19/grid view there is no app right-click context menu, unable to add to favorites
Comment_Body: @jaszhix I think this is a manifestation of https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/issues/7427 which effects all the menus when the menu height is close to the monitor height. I had thought Cinnamenu was immune but clearly not.

Name: Cinnamenu bug - Under Mint 19/grid view there is no app right-click context menu, unable to add to favorites
Comment_Body: Not sure if this is theme dependent or not, I can reproduce it in the default, Mint Y, and the X-Arc-Dark themes. Seems to only occur in the grid view. The easiest fix would be to prevent the menu from becoming too tall, there's logic in place for that for cinnamon 4.0, but its still letting the menu reach the exact height of the monitor (minus panel height).

Name: sticky@scollins: Unpinned notes are always lowered
Comment_Body: The sticky notes aren't actually windows, and there really isn't any way to make them behave that way short of a complete rewrite of the applet. I have no intention of doing that at this point.

Name: sticky@scollins: Unpinned notes are always lowered
Comment_Body: Just to be clear, the way the notes are supposed to behave right now is: * Pinned: All notes above all other windows * Unpinned: All notes below all other windows  Is that correct, or am I hitting some kind of bug?

Name: sticky@scollins: Unpinned notes are always lowered
Comment_Body: Pinned means notes are _always_ above windows. Unpinned means that they are only above windows when you click the applet, and they lower again when you click anything that isn't a note.

Name: sticky@scollins: Unpinned notes are always lowered
Comment_Body: OK; that seems OK but slightly buggy here: * Pinned works fine. * Unpinned, I must click the applet on the panel to raise the notes:   * Clicking a note isn't enough to raise the notes (By design? it would be very useful)     * Clicking in the text area of a note does allow editing the note, but does not raise the notes.     * In this edit while unraised mode, clicking another app focuses that app, but it can then be hard to return to the note simply by clicking the text area, or to drag the notes (changing focused window/ clicking the desktop/panel seems to help getting this 'feature' to work again)   * Clicking the panel applet opens the applet menu, and raises the notes.   * Clicking any other window now lowers the notes.   * However, once the notes are raised, if I click in the text area of a note, clicking other windows does nothing (I cannot return to other windows), the only way to lower the notes seems to be to click the panel or applet menu.  Allowing any click on a note to raise them would be great, since it is really annoying to go searching for the 0.5cm applet icon, when there is a large piece of note visible. Fixing unraising in edit mode would be good, too.  Short of rewriting the applet to use actual windows for the notes, it would be great if the notes could behave as a window as a whole: all the notes stay together, but when another window is raised above them, the notes do not fall behind /all/ windows but just the focused one (and any later focused windows): the notes' canvas has a position in the stack of windows. Not sure if that is easily doable either, though.  I have tested this with the latest version: 86703c4d @2018-09-06 "fix undeclared variable issue ..."  Thanks for your work! :)

Name: sticky@scollins: Unpinned notes are always lowered
Comment_Body: Yeah, there is a bug where sometimes the notes become unresponsive and wont lower. I've 'fixed' this kind of focus issue many times and they keep coming back. A lot of the issues you mentioned above are actually limitations of the toolkit and the window manager, and I can't really make it work like a normal window. If I ever end up spending a large amount of time on this, I'll probably end up rewriting the notes in Gtk, and it will fix a lot of these issues.

Name: Multi-Core System Monitor - problem with too much cores
Comment_Body: > Hi, my home workstartion have totally 88 CPU cores (dual CPU, 22 cores each, 44 w HT). Problem is, I see on 29" monitor only  around half of all my CPU cores. Possible to select somehow less space between rows with cores or show info in 2 colums? In my version of plugin I didn't seen anything like this. Your plugin is what I try to find very long time, for my 100% happyines you can add for every core color bar for load and at right side number with percentace load as is now and temperature? Similar like in this screenshot. Ideally with CPU model name? Similar like Core temp widget on Windows?  Sorry, this extension was just not designed for this extreme edge case.  I agree there is a void in the Linux space for something like CPU-Z, but it shouldn't be running inside Cinnamon. Its just supposed to be a part of the panel, and there is a limit to how much data an applet can show for practical reasons. I suggest not using the applet and looking for more appropriate monitors for server hardware.

Name: Multi-Core System Monitor - problem with too much cores
Comment_Body: Hi Jason, my workstations isn´t any extreme case. Many of my friends have new desktops with new AMD Threadripper where is 64 threads and in near future will be number of cores growth. You write about CPU-Z but I´m writing about Core temp app for Linux. I think super will be add to your util option to show only physical HW cores/all threads incl. HT cores. It divides number of rows to half. And if possible add to your util on same row as load percentage temp of this core. This will make your util much more usable. And ideally made it visible on desktop, not in cinnamon bar where it is too smal and not readable. Only in our BOINC team is around 800 users that are using Linux and try to solve same problem as I. Can check if possible to do it please? Please please :) As you know, intel released 18 cores/36 threads CPUs too :)

Name: Multi-Core System Monitor - problem with too much cores
Comment_Body: I'm running a Xeon with 14 cores/28 threads - on a 1440p display. The tooltip fills less than half of the monitor. This will also depend on how many disk and network devices are enabled.   The trouble will be figuring out where in /proc I could find the HT info, so we know to divide them or not.  That adds I/O to the applet, which is already demanding on Cinnamon. Fetching hardware info would, too. Those are legitimate suggestions, but this issue came packed with both a bug report and a feature request. I think for the vast majority of users this will not be an issue, even with threadripper. No consumer CPU will have anywhere near 88 cores for the next few years.

Name: Multi-Core System Monitor - problem with too much cores
Comment_Body: I understand you, but I think better will be add selection box for show load of cores as numbers or as load bar. Bar can be much thicker that number. And for analysis of cores load per CPU is much more usable to see it as bar instead as number. For fine tuning of CPU load you must see it graphically and in real time. With bars it is easy, with numbers not possible. BTW, looks like I find some bug, because when I open on my system settings menu, width of menu is wider than my monitor and I cannot resize it and I don´t see "Height" item in my settings. Think my pligin is in last version and on screenshots this item is presented. On my PC not. Why and for what it this item? This is height of what? BTW: Is possible to show cores on multiple CPU divided to 2 groups? So all cores from CPU0 and all cores from CPU1 separately (some line as divider or so)? It will be much clearer to read. Think Linux use first half of cores from CPU0 and second half from CPU1. Right?

Name: Multi-Core System Monitor - problem with too much cores
Comment_Body: > BTW, looks like I find some bug, because when I open on my system settings menu, width of menu is wider than my monitor and I cannot resize it and I don´t see "Height" item in my settings. Think my pligin is in last version and on screenshots this item is presented. On my PC not. Why and for what it this item? This is height of what?  Are you talking about the panel or the extension's own settings? The multi-core applet only has width control, height is controlled by the panel. Screenshot might help here - from the original issue its not clear exactly what part of the applet is causing issues, I assumed the tooltip was clipping the screen.  > For fine tuning of CPU load you must see it graphically and in real time. With bars it is easy, with numbers not possible.  I think what you're wanting is a desklet - this would need to be a new extension to make it look and behave like the picture you provided.  > Is possible to show cores on multiple CPU divided to 2 groups? So all cores from CPU0 and all cores from CPU1 separately (some line as divider or so)? It will be much clearer to read. Think Linux use first half of cores from CPU0 and second half from CPU1. Right?  Feel free to open a feature request. When you open an issue its good practice to keep it focused on one thing, otherwise it becomes harder to understand what the problem/suggestion is when we're discussing four things at once. For bug reports, providing logs and screenshots of the applet helps, too.

Name: Multi-Core System Monitor - problem with too much cores
Comment_Body: I´m talking about big width of extension's own settings. OK, will  send you screenshot of bug what will be at home.  Yes, in this case will be best to make it as desklet. Possible? And have time and want to do it? If yes, will be my plesure to do it for you testing and have idea how it may looks.

Name: Multi-Core System Monitor - problem with too much cores
Comment_Body: Sorry I'm already maintaining a system monitor applet that is adequate for me. This issue is finished, if you would like to report any further bugs or feature requests please open separate issues that are focused on one thing, and provide everything requested in the issue template.

Name: [batterymonitor@pdcurtis] can't replace contents of batteryscript.sh without breaking
Comment_Body: for those who are interested, This script works as long as it is invoked with its full path in the batteryscript.sh: ``` #!python  from subprocess import check_output import re  #read command-prompt  raw_out = check_output(["inxi", "-Bxx"]).decode("utf-8")  raw_out = repr(raw_out)  # Calculate Percentage batteries = re.findall(r"charge\\x03 ([0-9\.]{1,4}) Wh (?:.*?) \\x0312condition\\x03 ([0-9\.]{1,4})/", raw_out)  print(batteries) print(repr(raw_out)) currents, capables =zip(*batteries) current = sum(float(c) for c in currents) capable = sum(float(c) for c in capables) percentage = int(current / capable * 100)  with open("/tmp/.batteryPercentage", "w") as file:     file.write(str(percentage)+"\n")  #Get status  statuses = re.findall(r"status\\x03 (.*?)\\x03\\n", raw_out)  status = ", ".join([s for s in statuses if s != "N/A"])  with open("/tmp/.batteryState", "w") as file:     file.write(status + "\n")  ```

Name: [batterymonitor@pdcurtis] can't replace contents of batteryscript.sh without breaking
Comment_Body: Hello, @luerhard.  Just an FYI. You can simplify your regular expressions by disabling the color on the `inxi` output (`c0` option).  ```python raw_out = check_output(["inxi", "-Bxxc0"]).decode("utf-8") ```

Name: [batterymonitor@pdcurtis] can't replace contents of batteryscript.sh without breaking
Comment_Body: Uh wow, that is good to know - makes it a lot easier. Thank you !

Name: hwmonitor@sylfurd: Misc. clean up
Comment_Body: I have just updated the applet to benefit from your changes and see if this helps with linuxmint/Cinnamon#7844. Unfortunately the applet appears now to be broken, as the CPU indicator always stays close to zero. I can see that it is trying to draw the CPU usage curve, but it's like it can only be either 0 or 1%: nothing is drawn when CPU is inactive, as one would expect, but when CPU is active (regardless of if it's just one or all cores at once), only a thin blue line is drawn on the bottom-most pixel row. You can see if on the screenshot below:  ![cpu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2236577/46605995-3a5f7c00-caf3-11e8-8b5c-0cbd2bb319b1.png)

Name: hwmonitor@sylfurd: Misc. clean up
Comment_Body: I think the issue is line 286:      getData: function() {         GTop.glibtop_get_cpu(this.gtop);          this.current = this.gtop.idle;          let delta = this.gtop.total - this.last_total;         if (delta > 0) {             this.usage = (this.current - this.last) / delta;             this.last = this.current;             this.last_total = this.gtop.total;         }          return this.usage - 1;  // HERE     }  In the original code this was ```1 - this.usage```.

Name: hwmonitor@sylfurd: Misc. clean up
Comment_Body: That did it, thanks!

Name: batterymonitor@pdcurtis: determining editor is fragile
Comment_Body: @spantaleev Yes this is an issue I am aware of. In fact I have had branches ready for PRs for a number of applets ready to change to xdg-open fora while but, as you say, one can not be any more sure it will be available than xed. As far as I can tell every distribution which has implemented Cinnamon has also added the x utilities so I finally decided to leave be on the basis that "If it ain't broken don't fix it". I do plan to add a further note in the help files. The use of xdg-open has another problem that one does not know what program will be used and markdown files can be opened in all sorts of editors which is not the intention for some of the files. In summary I do not plan a high priority fix to this or other applets but this should receive a Feature Request Tag so I do not forget!

[xsession-errors.txt](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/files/2356250/xsession-errors.txt) No glass.log found in my home folder. I think I found the bug. If you select random color in the option menu, you can't add a new note. With a predefined color, it's working for me.

Name: Adding new note with Cinnamon 3.8.8 under mint 19 is not working
Comment_Body: Thanks. With your log I was able to quickly pinpoint the issue and fix it. I wasn't seeing that issue because the code path that was erroring out is only reached when the default theme is set to random (which mine wasn't).

Name: Adding new note with Cinnamon 3.8.8 under mint 19 is not working
Comment_Body: Great work. Thank you.

Name: Icing App manager
Comment_Body: There are a lot of issues with LibreOffice that have been tracked. Issues should be filed at the [dedicated repo](https://github.com/jaszhix/icingtaskmanager/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+libreoffice), as stated in the [readme](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/master/IcingTaskManager%40json/README.md). If you do file an issue there, please fill out the issue template, otherwise its less likely to get fixed.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: Additionally, the `newNM` variable is unnecessary in that commit and the old code handled the situation in a cleaner fashion by defining a wrapper for the function.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: (it is possible that the last change using the `newNM` is possibly necessary due to needing to use `apply` later, but I am unsure about that as it wasn't needed on Mint or Fedora that way, and in either case it could still use the old system with a slight modification).

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: I think I changed it because the original fix didn't work on Debian. Does this occur on Fedora 28?  I recall testing this change on both Debian and Fedora at the time, and it worked everywhere I tested.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: It does not crash in Fedora 28 but doesn't show anything at all.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: Correction. I don't know what was hiding it, but it actually still is crashing in Fedora 28 and Cinnamon v3.8.8.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: Can you provide logs?

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: The relevant .xsession-error log:  (cinnamon:23082): libnm-util-ERROR **: 22:04:30.637: libnm symbols detected; Mixing libnm with libnm-util/libnm-glib is not supported  This is exactly the error I was getting before introducing that fix. Basically it is saying that you are trying to load libnm even though libnetworkmanager (or whatever) is already loaded.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: My guess is that it is somewhat random based on the order in which things load and I randomly was able to boot once without it crashing but typically (i.e. almost always) it crashes.  It is also possible that if the default Network Manager applet is disabled  this error can also be avoided.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: Does reverting the change fix it for you? This was changed because of #1735. I have a hard time spinning up two VMs to test this at the moment, but will look into it when I can. I think there's been a [network manager](https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/7699) [applet](https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/7668) [fix](https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/7536) in limbo for a while now because of breaking Debian.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: Fedora doesn't use the old depreciated nm-glib bindings in any release, the nm-glib bindings are totally removed from F29. This means any thirdparty applet that uses networking will need fixing.  https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/7699  F**k being held up by moldly crappy debian policy.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: @coderforlife A quick fix would be to remove the **NetworkManager-glib** package

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: @coderforlife  or reverse the code in ~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23/3.4/DataProviders.js   ``` let CONNECTED_STATE, NMClient_new, newNM; // Fallback to the old version. tryFn(function() {   const NM = imports.gi.NM;   CONNECTED_STATE = NM.DeviceState.ACTIVATED;   NMClient_new = NM.Client.new;   newNM = true; }, function() {   const NMClient = imports.gi.NMClient;   const NetworkManager = imports.gi.NetworkManager;   CONNECTED_STATE = NetworkManager.DeviceState ? NetworkManager.DeviceState.ACTIVATED : 0;   NMClient_new = NMClient.Client.new;   newNM = false; }); ```

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: FTR multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic works fine on f29 as NetworkManager-glib doesn't exist.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 broken on Fedora with v 1.8.3
Comment_Body: @leigh123linux Removing `NetworkManager-glib` (and the only dependent package `libnm-gtk`) worked! It is likely that that package was still around since I have been doing upgrades and not clean installs. Thanks for noticing that it could be removed easily.  Also, I was the one who wrote the original code to manage the Fedora system that had both. But I guess it wasn't quite complete on systems that only had the newer version.

Name: Feature Request: Drag and Drop Reorder Menu Items
Comment_Body: What applet? You're supposed to include the name/uuid in the title.

Name: Feature Request: Drag and Drop Reorder Menu Items
Comment_Body: Sorry, CinnaMenu

Name: Feature Request: Drag and Drop Reorder Menu Items
Comment_Body: Ok, I maintain that one. You can drag and drop re-order menu items in the favorites category, but everything else is alphabetical. I think it would add too much complexity to enforce ordering per-category.

Name: weather@mockturtl: Show forecasts on incorrect days
Comment_Body: The Yahoo weather service is returning [stale data for your location](http://query.yahooapis.com/v1/public/yql?format=json&q=select%20*%20from%20weather.forecast%20where%20woeid=%22349859%22%20and%20u=%22c%22):  ```json5 "forecast": [ { "code": "28", "date": "21 Aug 2018",  // stale! "day": "Tue", "high": "13", "low": "7", "text": "Mostly Cloudy" }, ```  We can't do anything about this, but the data for several US locations I tested is current.  For example, try NYC: `2459115`.  Hopefully it will fix itself soon.  https://github.com/mockturtl/cinnamon-weather/wiki/Test-my-city

Name: weather@mockturtl: Show forecasts on incorrect days
Comment_Body: > The Yahoo weather service is returning [stale data for your location](http://query.yahooapis.com/v1/public/yql?format=json&q=select%20*%20from%20weather.forecast%20where%20woeid=%22349859%22%20and%20u=%22c%22):  It looks like the problem with this WOEID has cleared up.  ```json5 "pubDate": "Wed, 05 Sep 2018 12:00 AM CLST", "condition": {   "code": "31",   "date": "Wed, 05 Sep 2018 12:00 AM CLST",   "temp": "10",   "text": "Clear" }, "forecast": [ {   "code": "32",   "date": "05 Sep 2018",   // fresh!   "day": "Wed",   "high": "16",   "low": "8",   "text": "Sunny" }, ```  @jjf-zero Does it look OK now?

Name: weather@mockturtl: Show forecasts on incorrect days
Comment_Body: Same or similar issue here with no proxy. My woeid is `766273`.  The first day in the forecast is _today_, when it is supposed to be _tomorrow_. It is repeating the information above. I know the API provides it like that, but I guess you could skip the first one.

Name: weather@mockturtl: Show forecasts on incorrect days
Comment_Body: > The first day in the forecast is _today_,  when it is supposed to be _tomorrow_  Starting from "today" is the expected behavior.  (For example, you want to know today's forecast high temperature.)  When the issue was reported (Aug 22), the data for Santiago was incorrectly showing the _previous_ day (Aug 21).  I think this issue can be closed.

Name: weather@mockturtl: Show forecasts on incorrect days
Comment_Body: Yes. Is Ok now.El 8 sep. 2018 3:48 PM, mockturtl <notifications@github.com> escribió: The Yahoo weather service is returning stale data for your location:  It looks like the problem with this WOEID has cleared up. "day": "Wed",   "high": "16",   "low": "8",   "text": "Sunny" }, @jjf-zero Does it look OK now?  —You are receiving this because you were mentioned.Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread. Name: batterymonitor@pdcurtis: Updated warning message.

The associated comment made in the original issue does not need fixing as the requirement is already in the description on the spices page and the built in help file under Requirements - perhaps it should be higher up but it is there so please close the issue when the merge has taken place. Thanks.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj Cannot move up/down workspaces in Cinnamon 3.8.8
Comment_Body: @sn0w75 can you provide the steps to reproduce this issue? I'm currently not able to duplicate this issue, but probably because I'm not following the steps correctly. Thanks.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj Cannot move up/down workspaces in Cinnamon 3.8.8
Comment_Body: @icarter09 The steps to reproduce are simply to, with Cinnamon version 3.8.8, install the applet, create some rows, then try to use Ctrl+Alt+Up and Ctrl+Alt+Down to go up/down a row. Neither keyboard shortcut will work. I made a short video demonstrating the issue to make it easier to see and understand what's going on: (EDIT: re-uploaded the video since mic was muted) https://youtu.be/7ZkHWaxlpM0

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj Cannot move up/down workspaces in Cinnamon 3.8.8
Comment_Body: @sn0w75 thanks for the video.  I created several rows and columns and was able to use 'Ctrl+Alt+Up' and 'Ctrl+Alt+Down' to traverse them all with no problems. I'm using Linux Mint 19 64bit with Cinnamon 3.8.8. The applet version is 2018-05-05 18:03 UTC.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj Cannot move up/down workspaces in Cinnamon 3.8.8
Comment_Body: @icarter09 Hmmm, I wonder what the difference is between your setup and mine. At the very least, I've seen one other user in the comments section who ran into this same issue when debian picked up Cinnamon 3.8.8 here in the past week: https://cinnamon-spices.linuxmint.com/applets/view/116 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4862240/44461856-2e1d6f00-a5d8-11e8-9cbd-2557c2419482.png)  I'm not familiar with applet development, but if I knew how to get some actual error output when using an applet, I might be able to dig around a bit and figure something out.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj Cannot move up/down workspaces in Cinnamon 3.8.8
Comment_Body: So, when I tried fiddling around with the Workspace Grid today, it worked perfectly fine for some reason! In fact, I even went back to look at the comments, and the other individual who ran into this issue seems to have experienced the exact same thing: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4862240/44610064-228c9c80-a7c0-11e8-8b26-6f0e252a964a.png)  It's truly strange, because you would think that if uninstalling and re-installing the applet didn't work before, it wouldn't work now, but clearly something has changed between my last attempt and my attempt today.  I think it's probably fine to close this issue, unless someone wants to investigate the sort of strange issue that only (temporarily?) crops up during a package transition (from Cinnamon 3.6.x to 3.8.8).

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj Cannot move up/down workspaces in Cinnamon 3.8.8
Comment_Body: @sn0w75 awesome news that it is working correctly for you now! Thanks also for updating this ticket with your findings.  @jaszhix I believe this issue can be closed out now.

Name: Any keyboard shortcut for this? to stop and start recording?
Comment_Body: If you know the command to start/stop recording you can map them to shortcuts in Cinnamon Settings -> Keyboard -> Shortcuts -> Custom Shortcuts.

Name: Any keyboard shortcut for this? to stop and start recording?
Comment_Body: dont know what command  is to invoke so i can add it on the short cut

Name: Any keyboard shortcut for this? to stop and start recording?
Comment_Body: What applet are you talking about? Cinnamon's native screen recording is toggled on/off via `Shift-Ctrl-Alt-R` by default.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Right-click Context Menu Doesn't Follow Cinnamon Themes Correctly
Comment_Body: I'm confused by this one, the context menu looks fine to me using Mint-X or the Linux Mint theme. Can you provide a screenshot that highlights illegibility? You don't mention which version of Cinnamenu you are using.  ![lm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6859057/43815048-480e5ff0-9a93-11e8-81da-10ba439ba655.png) ![mintx](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6859057/43815049-4a30ba62-9a93-11e8-92a9-5c33c725e868.png)

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Right-click Context Menu Doesn't Follow Cinnamon Themes Correctly
Comment_Body: The Cinnamox themes suffer with this at the moment (in 19 and 18.3) and I haven't got round to fixing it in the themes yet.  I'm not sure which Cinnamenu update changed things because it wasn't a problem immediately after the last time I updated the themes.   Once fixed in Cinnamox I'll port the fix into the Spice build of Adapta as-well. I'll try and do this next weekend.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Right-click Context Menu Doesn't Follow Cinnamon Themes Correctly
Comment_Body: The context menu is using these classes:  ```js this.menu.actor.set_style_class_name('menu menu-context-menu menu-background starkmenu-background'); ```  I added those classes for the most compatibility, but if a theme is still not styled correctly I would say its a theme issue.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Right-click Context Menu Doesn't Follow Cinnamon Themes Correctly
Comment_Body: It's fixed in Adapta and Cinnamox now anyway.

Name: Cinnamenu@json: Left click does not work after right click
Comment_Body: Thanks for the quick fix!!

Name: Cinnamenu@json: more than 1 instance
Comment_Body: Probably by editing metadata.json with the max-instances key, but its untested and not something I plan on supporting.

Name: Mem-monitor-text: Removed label.
Comment_Body: I don't think that is what the requestor asked for - he asked for an option to remove, not full removal.  However in the context of a multi-lingual project, having untranslated embedded English acronyms is not a great idea, so am happy to merge.    Regards  Simon

Name: Mem-monitor-text: Removed label.
Comment_Body: @brownsr my bad. Attempted to work on another ticket before I went to bed, which in hindsight was not a good idea. I'll start looking into implementing what the requestor asked for.

Name: batterymonitor@pdcurtis - BAMS applet error with LM 19.0
Comment_Body: @CJConline the reason for the install message is that since version 1.3.2, both sox and zenity are needed for the battery monitor applet to function correctly. I got the message warning message that you stated, then installed sox (zenity was already at the latest version). After install, I removed and added the battery monitor applet back and the warning message no longer appeared.   Let me know if installing both sox and zenity fixi the warning issue.

Name: batterymonitor@pdcurtis - BAMS applet error with LM 19.0

Chris  PS: Would be good it the need to install sox and zenity was mentioned in the description on the Cinnamon Spices pages for less experienced user like me. Name: batterymonitor@pdcurtis: charging icon hard to see with color-deficient vision
Comment_Body: @focusaurus There are so many different forms of deficient colour vision that i am not sure that it would be possible to satisfy all of them by default. You can however customise by changing the icons in ~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/batterymonitor@pdcurtis/icons to suit yourself.  The applet also has a red border when discharging which should be be clear to most people with a yellow/green deficiency. The only other way to be sure is to not use colours at all as is the case with much of the Mint standard themes and applets but I find a bright colour 'traffic light' is much more effective for applets where there are 'warnings' etc which need to be heeded.  Yours is however a useful point and one I will keep in mind in any major updates or new applets. Out of interest, do you (and others with colour deficiencies) use any special themes and sets of icons?

Name: batterymonitor@pdcurtis: charging icon hard to see with color-deficient vision
Comment_Body: Thanks for your response. I will look for the lack of red border to confirm my power cord is plugged in and working.  To be clear, I'm not asking you to satisfy all forms of color deficient vision. I'm just asking for a specific change.  As to themes and icons, the only change I have made for vision is using the Mint-X-Aqua desktop theme because it has more contrast between the active window button in the window list and the inactive buttons.

Name: Old unpopular umaintained applet removal
Comment_Body: @collinss Does the score indicate that no one is dowloading them or using them? Was wondering if these could be offloaded to someone that would be willing to maintain the applets. If so, I would be willing to take over these applets.

Name: Old unpopular umaintained applet removal
Comment_Body: @icarter09 Yeah, a score of 0 usually indicates that no one really cares about them. You never know though, which is why I left it open for a while. Basically, I'm trying to clean up a little bit. Most of these have been abandoned since before we moved everything to github (over a year and a half ago). Some of them haven't had a developer in several years. Combine that with the fact that they all have zero ratings and that seems like enough reason to remove them. If they had a developer or people actually showed interest, I'd leave them.  If there are any that you would like to maintain, you're welcome to, but there are a lot of more popular applets that don't currently have a maintainer, and I'd much rather focus on those. I'd much rather have a smaller number of really good ones that people can easily choose from, than a much larger number of mediocre, half-functioning, or completely broken applets that users have to wade through to find anything good. (Most of them will just give up after a little bit of wading and assume that it's all junk.)

Name: Old unpopular umaintained applet removal
Comment_Body: @collinss Thanks for explaining that and completely agree with everything you said. Better to start culling through them now then waiting several months and all these applets that no one is using or maintaining build into a mammoth pile of junk. And better to focus on the ones that are being used.   I'm not too worried about maintaining them since it looks like no one is really using them. Do you have a list of the ones that you mentioned that are more popular, but do not have a maintainer? I'll happily step up to maintain those applets and put my focus on them.

Name: Old unpopular umaintained applet removal
Comment_Body: @icarter09 I don't have a list right off hand, but you can look at the info.json in the root folder of each applet (here on github). If it is unmaintained, the author field will be none. Also, I noticed you did some work recently on the command runner applet. If you want, I can leave that one out of my pull request.

Name: Old unpopular umaintained applet removal
Comment_Body: @collinss I fixed an issue with the CommandRunner applet that caused it to never start up properly. Someone posted that as an "Issue", but if the numbers say no one is using it then feel free to keep it on the list of removals.  I'll put together a list of all the applets that I can find that have no author and remove entries in the list that are applets being removed in your PR. I can send you that list to figure out which ones are being used and worth maintaining. Once that is figured out, then I would be more than happy to maintain those applets.

Comment_Body: @collinss I have the list put together. Let me know if you want me to post it here or somewhere else.

Name: placesCenter@scollins - Invalid search.py permissions
Comment_Body: Hi @pjobson, this is caused by a regression in Cinnamon 3.6. The problem is that the library that cinnamon-settings uses to extract the zip file from the spices site doesn't preserve file permissions, and the previous workaround wasn't included when the code in question was rewritten. It has been fixed in Cinnamon 3.8, but unfortunately there is nothing that can be done for 3.6 besides manually editing the permissions as you did.

Name: placesCenter@scollins - Invalid search.py permissions
Comment_Body: If you want, you can add, at the beginning of the _init function of MyApplet, the line: `GLib.spawn_command_line_async("bash -c 'cd "+ metadata.path + " && chmod 755 search.py'");`  Thus, every time this applet starts, the right permissions are set to the search.py script.

Name: IcingTaskManager@json Incorrect old style of window titles and minimized windows
Comment_Body: ITM checks focused, running, and pinned app button states. Minimized apps are not tracked. I have already done a lot of tail chasing trying to get themes to play nice in an unsupported manner with expressing "running" app styling that the Cinnamon CSS doesn't currently support, and this is very likely a theme problem I can't do much about currently. Please see https://github.com/jaszhix/icingtaskmanager/issues/199 as an example of this.  Also, always check the ITM repo first because that's where I prefer to track issues for it. I will try to keep track of bug reports here, but its not likely to make it into my note tracker app that integrates with the repo. Can you please provide the settings JSON and ~/.xsession_errors log? ITM's repo issue template applies to ITM issues here too because the repo is mentioned in the readme as the preferred bug tracker.

Name: [sessionManager@scollins]: Choose which buttons are displayed in the …
Comment_Body: Ideally, it would be good to automatically remove something if it's not going to work. I have one or two entries that are only supposed to show when the conditions are right. Do you have any idea how to check if the hardware supports hibernate? That's not exactly my area of expertise. As for allowing the user to choose, I'm not sure we need that if we can be a little more intelligent about when to show something or not, though I'm not completely against the idea either. I'm just worried that it might be a little overkill.

Name: [sessionManager@scollins]: Choose which buttons are displayed in the …
Comment_Body: Unfortunately no ; the only way to know if something is not working, like hibernation, is to try it.  I tried to display or not some options depending on the key values in dconf, but there is a bug (https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/issues/7592): these keys are not used by Cinnamon; yet they exist!

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: This bug has already been found and fixed. I'll roll an update sometime in the next few days and post here when it is done. Thanks for your patience :)

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: Actually it looks like the update process is automatic. Please update your applet in the "Add Applets to Panel" window and try again.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: I just install the applet from this repository. The shortcuts `<Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>` and `<Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Down>` persist don't work.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: I'm sure that updating the applet should fix your problem. Perhaps you've not updated it properly? Here is what you need to do,  Right click on your panel. Choose "Add applets to the panel" Click the "Download" tab. If a dialog box pops up and asks you to update/refresh, say yes. If you do not get asked to refresh click the refresh button (circular arrows) at bottom of window. After refresh, locate Workspace Grid applet in the list and click the Update button (single circular arrow). The button will change to a check mark when the update is complete. You should now have an up to date version of the applet. You'll need to restart Cinnamon to get the new applet code to run.  Let me know how it goes. :)

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: Thanks for your answer.  I did what you described in your last post. At the 6th line of your instructions, I already have a check mark. It looks like I have the latest version of this applet. It isn't surprising since, I installed this applet from the master branch of this Github repository. To be sure to got a clean installation, I started by delete the directories below : `~/.cinnamon/configs/workspace-grid@hernejj/` `~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/workspace-grid@hernejj/` He is an archive of the files that are presently in those directories : https://framadrop.org/r/k5aLP22jZa#j7/Je3jTzywOnuTI5nOp6815yDNnqF4jL/YU6ugzS8M=  An point that could be interesting, is that when I press `<Ctrl>` + `<Alt>` + `<Up>` with the focus on a terminal window, I have  `;7A`  characters that appear in the buffer. I don't know how shortcuts in applets works, but it looks like pressed keys aren't filtered by the shortcut mechanism.  May be it's not significative, but before updating the applet, when I updated cinnamon and saw that this shortcuts wasn't working anymore, I unattributed in the cinnamon shortcut setting panel the corresponding shortcuts. I will search how to reinitialize those configurations.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: Hi there, I went a bit deeper in the inspection of this problem. I modified the `applet.js` to log some information.  Here is my modified `applet.js` : https://framadrop.org/r/54DmUl4nXT#mqTk63Vfo+OZ3WDnEq1UQrU2XbMJbn6PZPVfDKBl7Qs=  After I restarted Cinnamon, I obtain the both messages that talk about registering up and down key. When I press `Ctrl` + `Alt` + `Left or Right` I obtain the message with the good binding key. When I press `Ctrl` + `Alt` + `Up or Down` I obtain no message ! Here is the problem.  I will try to continue to inspect this problem, but It looks hard to find an accessible documentation for Muffin.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: Installing dconf-editor and restoring org.cinammon.desktop.keybindings.vw.switch-to-workspace-up and switch-to-workspace-down to their default values solved the problem for me.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: Thank you for your answer. I can not test your solution because I do not have anymore the computer with the problem. Anyway, this solution looks like it could solve my problem. I set this topic solved.

Name: workspace-grid@hernejj : <Ctrl>+<Alt>+<Up>/<Down> shortcuts don't work
Comment_Body: Hi, I would like to bring this topic up because I am encountering this problem and I can't get rid of it. My environment is: Linux Mint 19 Tara Cinnamon 3.8.9 Looking at the last posts I dug a bit in dconf-editor and I found keyboard shortcuts for "showing window selection" and "showing workspace selection" (their names can be a little different because I am translating from my language) actually modify: org.cinnamon.desktop.keybindings.wm switch-to-workspace-down org.cinnamon.desktop.keybindings.wm switch-to-workspace-up I am not sure but I think this they could conflict with workspace-grid.

Name: spices-notifier@germanfr - 3.8 only?
Comment_Body: It is written using the new class syntax, which wasn't supported in < 3.8. This is an applet for Cinnamon xlet developers and I'd expect them to have the latest version in a reasonable period of time, so I don't plan to do any backwards compatibility. That doesn't mean I will break things when new features are released, but I wrote it a few days ago under 3.8 already. However, you are free to patch it until you update your system. I guess you only need to change the classes to the old _init structure. Sorry.

Name: spices-notifier@germanfr - 3.8 only?
Comment_Body: No worries. I guessed that was the case but just wanted to check. It's a very helpful tool BTW...thanks.

Name: placesCenter@scollins
Comment_Body: Can you please check the permissions of the file ```~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/placesCenter@scollins/search.py```? It sounds like the executable bit in the file permissions isn't getting retained when the applet is installed through cinnamon-settings. If so, the issue will be resolved by https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/7546. In the mean time you should be able to fix the issue by changing the permissions on this file.

Name: [Cinnamenu@json] Search field line-height should be greater
Comment_Body: Hello.  I have found that the problem is not the GTK theme, but the Cinnamon theme. My theme is a modified Arc-Dark-Red that uses Fira Sans font of 10.5 pt. I think that the problem can be in the adjustment of the search box height using pixels instead `line-height`. Maybe setting the search box `height` to `auto` and the `line-height` to for instance `1.25` would fix the problem.  This is the font settings of my Cinnamon theme: ``` stage {   font-family: "Fira Sans", sans-serif;   font-size: 10.5pt;   color: #a4a4a4; } ```  Thanks.

Name: [Cinnamenu@json] Search field line-height should be greater
Comment_Body: Hi,  I can reproduce this issue with Cinnamenu 3.2.1 by using a Cinnamon theme with a large vertical padding set for #menu-search-entry  Quick fix is to comment out the height declaration in Cinnamenu applet.js entirely which lets the theme control the height of the search box. I've not as it stands tested this extensively with a variety of themes.   Line 2157 >  ```     this.searchEntry = new St.Entry({       name: 'menu-search-entry',       hint_text: hintText,       track_hover: true,       can_focus: true,       //height: 32 * global.ui_scale,     }); ```

Name: [WIP] netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.5
Comment_Body: @jaszhix Many thanks for doing some tests.I have removed the [WIP] and am happy for this to be merged

Name: [WIP] netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.5
Comment_Body: I've discovered an issue with the way this checks for the new NM library. It assumes if it can't find the NetworkManager namespace through get_loaded_namespaces that the GI binding isn't installed, but apparently that's not the case on Debian. I tested the fix for that in #1780 on Mint 18.3, 19, Fedora 27, and Debian Buster. I think using try-catch (wrapped in a function called tryFn in multicore-sys-monitor), and falling back to the new lib is the most compatible way to go about this.  cc @coderforlife

Name: [WIP] netusagemonitor@pdcurtis Update to version 3.2.5
Comment_Body: @jaszhix Many thanks for the timely warning  I have replaced the [WIP] while I look at this and you get more experience with the changes in multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic .  I will hold #1767 as well

Comment_Body: I tried to use the old code from https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/commit/bcd6d7e1987354ae2d981b5f232fee693c675a16 in `convenience.js` and entered fixed path value to `~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com/schemas`  and I'm getting `error t=2018-04-08T20:45:47Z Failed to open file “~/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com/schemas/gschemas.compiled”: open() failed: No such file or directory` but when I copy that path to `ll` in shell, seems the path is correct and file exists. `-rw-r--r-- 1 vlatko users 356 Apr  8 13:58 '/home/vlatko/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com/schemas/gschemas.compiled`  However, if I put the absolute path `/home/vlatko/.local/share/cinnamon/applets/hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com/schemas`, the error changes to   `error t=2018-04-08T20:53:32Z GSettings schema not found: [boxed instance proxy GIName:Gio.SettingsSchema jsobj@0x7febc6c9e250 native@0x5622fa1b90f0] `

Name: hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com - schema not found
Comment_Body: Tried solution to identical issue form old original repo at https://github.com/projecthamster/cinnamon-applet/issues/18, but the error now is ``` error t=2018-04-08T22:27:52Z redeclaration of formal parameter schema error t=2018-04-08T22:27:52Z [Applet "hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com"]: Error importing applet.js from hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com ```

Name: hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com - schema not found
Comment_Body: Hello, @vlatkoB.  There are several problems clashing in here. Follow the bellow steps to make the applet work.  1. Completely remove the applet and re-install it from Cinnamon's applets manager (do not edit anything from the applet's code). 2. Install the settings schema with the following command (It will ask for password): `pkexec cinnamon-schema-install /full/path/to/schemas/org.cinnamon.hamster-applet.gschema.xml` 3. And lastly, set execution permissions to the **prefs.js** file (located inside the xlet folder). 4. Now place it in any panel and it should work immediately.  **Edit:** I forgot to mention that I did these tests on Ubuntu 18.04 Beta2 and Linux Mint 18.3 and both systems with Cinnamon version 3.6.7. I didn't test on Archlinux. I also tested with the hamster-applet package installed and all seems to work fine.  ### Problems with xlets installation process  @collinss (?)  1. Schema files found inside sub-folders are ignored (not installed when an xlet is installed). 2. Xlet's file permissions aren't retained. If I [download the applet](https://cinnamon-spices.linuxmint.com/applets/view/140) mentioned in this issue from its Spices page and extract it, the **prefs.js** file has execution permissions. But the downloaded (and ultimately installed) package from the applets manager has all permissions changed.

Name: hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com - schema not found
Comment_Body: Hi @Odyseus, thanks, that solved the problem. :-)  A note for __Arch__ users.  `cinnamon-schema-install` (and `cinnamon-schema-remove`) are not installed with cinnamon package, so to use this method, you must create that file(s) in `/user/bin` directory manually. Script code for both can be found at https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/tree/master/files/usr/bin.  EDIT: Disregard note for Arch users. `cinnamon-schema-install` (and remove) were removed from cinnamon stable release, and moved to `/usr/share/cinnamon/cinnamon-settings/bin/installSchema.py`.

Name: hamster@projecthamster.wordpress.com - schema not found
Comment_Body: I moved the gschema.xml file to the parent directory, so Cinnamon installs it properly. The missing permission has to be investigated.  Thanks @Odyseus

Name: bash-sensors@pkkk: Dynamic tooltips
Comment_Body: > Is the pot file automatically updated?  No, you can update the reference pot file with cinnamon-json-makepot, though its been renamed to [cinnamon-xlet-makepot ](https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/7149) on Cinnamon git with small differences in arguments. Then use msgmerge to update the translation PO files based on the reference file. I use some scripts to automate it and make it easier/quicker for me.   [Example cinnamon-xlet-makepot script](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/master/Cinnamenu%40json/locale.sh) [Example cinnamon-json-makepot script](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/master/IcingTaskManager%40json/locale.sh)  Do you want this merged now, or do you want to amend it first?

Name: bash-sensors@pkkk: Dynamic tooltips
Comment_Body: Thanks @jaszhix for the hints how to do it.  May I ask you a very big favour? Would it be very complicated and time consuming for you to update the pot files? That would help me quite a lot, because I have to learn all steps and I am currently quite busy with other projects' deadlines approaching too quickly for my liking keeping me busy for the next month or two.

Name: bash-sensors@pkkk: Dynamic tooltips
Comment_Body: I've got my hands full for the next couple weeks myself, so can't promise anything right now. There's no rush on this though, approach it whenever you want. 🙂

Name: bash-sensors@pkkk: Dynamic tooltips
Comment_Body: Just run this command in the applets directory: ``` cinnamon-json-makepot --js po/bash-sensors@pkkk.pot  ``` This will update the `.pot` file. There's no need to update the other translations files `.po`. Those files are updated by the translators.

Comment_Body: Thanks, @NikoKrause!

Comment_Body: I was having the same problem. The solution for me was to update the extension as recommended. I opened up the Applet Manager and clicked on the "Download" tab. Comment_Body: Thanks, reasoning for keeping the dependencies in the description is that end-users who don't visit the spices page and download via the Applet module only will still be alerted to the dependencies via the Applet module description and via the About box once installed.  I can add a short README as-well if you prefer, but still think it's a good idea to note the dependencies in the description.

Reboot generates the same error message and the applet is missing in the bar.  Any suggestions will be appreciated.

Name: slingshot@jfarthing84: Fix for Cinnamon 3.8
Comment_Body: @jaszhix I can see you are making a number of changes to many applets to make them compatible with 3.8 including a different mechanism for 'including' javascript files.   Have I missed the list of the changes required for 3.8 so I can check my own applets or have you got some automated system going to flag the problem areas?

Name: slingshot@jfarthing84: Fix for Cinnamon 3.8
Comment_Body: Its only xlets that have multiple JS files that need to be updated in regards to the new importer code. Cinnamon files (e.g. imports.ui/misc/perf) and GObject introspection bindings (imports.gi.*) don't need any changes. The file loader for xlets needed to be changed because we removed the [sub-importer patch](https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/6790) and some others that made it diverge from GJS for easier maintainability (the mozjs52 rebase would have broke them).   Reverting to the vanilla GJS importer results in applets not being able to be reloaded - as has been the case in Cinnamon 3.6 - which is useful for updating applets, and live-reloading during development, so the [new importer](https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/commit/f01bd803d5ae8978d934e1a84d07222e6ec866c4) works around it entirely by handling file I/O in Cinnamon instead.   There was [one PR](https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/pull/7349) I thought would be merged, but decided to pull it because it had its own set of regressions. Unfortunately I was testing using it, which is not compatible with what's in master now, so I have been revisiting some of my initial fixes for 3.8.

Name: slingshot@jfarthing84: Fix for Cinnamon 3.8
Comment_Body: @jaszhix Thanks for the information and the links. I found some more information I knew nothing about!  I have tried several of my applets under 3.8.1 using Manjaro/Cinnamon spin as a liveUSB so I have reasonable confidence there are no show-stoppers under Arch or Cinnamon 3.8 and I had already tried most of them under Fedora 27

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: I guess the following would work (although I am not a JS programmer and have no way to test this on non-Fedora systems without lots of effort). I haven't tested this code at all, but I think the concept is solid.  Replace the two Network Manager imports with the following:  ``` let CONNECTED_STATE; let NMClient_new; tryFn(function() {   const NM = imports.gi.NM;   CONNECTED_STATE = NM.DeviceState.ACTIVATED;   NMClient_new = () => { return NM.Client.new(null); } }, function(e) {   const NMClient = imports.gi.NMClient;   const NetworkManager = imports.gi.NetworkManager;   CONNECTED_STATE = NetworkManager.DeviceState.CONNECTED;   NMClient_new = () => { return NMClient.Client.new(); } }); ```  Then `this.nmClient = NMClient.Client.new();` is replaced by `this.nmClient = NMClient_new();` and `NetworkManager.DeviceState.CONNECTED` is replaced by `CONNECTED_STATE`.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: Thanks for pointing this out to me. I was assuming the new NM typelib was a new library since it has different namespaces - I'm guessing there isn't a way to load the old typelib on the same system. In your example you have the right idea. `const` is block scoped so the declarations would need to be moved out of the try-catch.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: But the variables that are `const`-ed are not used outside those blocks since they are just used to create some other variables (`CONNECTED_STATE` and `NMClient_new`). Also, if you do try to load both, depending on how, a warning will sometimes be shown in one of the error logs (I forget if it is glass.log or xsessionerrors.log, only showed up like once or twice out of several restart attempts) and Cinnamon will die. I strongly doubt there is anyway to get them to coexist in the same application.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: I won't be able to PR this for at least a week, but if you're able to test on Mint 18.3 in a VM, feel free to open a PR.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: So I tried these changes in my fork: https://github.com/coderforlife/cinnamon-spices-applets/commit/0dec5ee0ad33f578c9aecfe348f49dfc5f83ebe4  It works in Fedora but causes Cinnamon in Mint 18.3 to freeze. Looking at the `.xsession-errors` file I see the following relevant messages:  ``` Cinnamon warning: Log level 16: cannot register existing type 'NMSetting' Cinnamon warning: Log level 8: g_once_init_leave: assertion 'result != 0' failed Cinnamon warning: Log level 8: g_type_register_static: assertion 'parent_type > 0' failed  (cinnamon: 2584): libnm-CRITICAL **: _nm_register_setting: assertion 'type != G_TYPE_INVALID' failed Cinnamon warning: Log level 8: g_once_init_leave: assertion 'result != 0' failed ```  In `.cinnamon/glass.log` there are no interesting messages, in fact there is no line for `Loaded applet multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 in ## ms` like the rest of the applets.  When I look in the `/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/girepository-1.0/` folder it has all three NM typelibs: `NM`, `NMClient`, and `NetworkManager`. My guess is that the NM one is being loaded even though it shouldn't be.  Do you have any other ideas on guessing which one should be used?

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: Well, one quick way I found was to run `lsof -p <cinnamon pid> | grep NetworkManager-1.0.typelib`. If there is a 0 exit code than we need to use the new system, otherwise we need to use the old system. This still means I need to be able to get the current Cinnamon's PID and be able to run that command and get the exit code. Additionally, this check may not work unless the built-in network applet loads before this one does (I believe it is able to detect which to use and loads the proper one).

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: Okay, my latest attempt actually works for both Fedora and Mint! https://github.com/coderforlife/cinnamon-spices-applets/commit/602e8a10534624b35600f4a4926d2da4fc2b653e  It uses a small bash script to detect if `NetworkManager-1.0.typelib` is already being used or not using the above command line, resulting in the exit code of either `0` (yes, old-style) or `256` (no, new-style). The `DataProviders.js` uses `GLib.spawn_sync` to get this value and then acts accordingly. This works mostly great.  On the Mint system (in a VirtualBox) it takes 30-60 ms for the plugin to start which seems fast enough (seeing that the entire AppletManager takes ~500ms). However on my Fedora system (run on bare-metal) it takes a whopping 700 ms to start (out of 1144 ms which means that all the other plugins are starting faster while this one is significantly slower). My guess is that this is because it is running as a bash script which is then sourcing my `.bashrc` file which takes some time to run.  If you have ideas how to suppress that I think this would be ready for a pull-request.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: My guess was wrong, even after clearing out my `.bashrc` file it still takes 500-1000ms to load the applet on my Fedora machine. Any thoughts on why this may be would be appreciated.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: The newest version has times down to 200ms on my Fedora system and 60ms on Linux Mint in a VirtualBox. The high time required for mine is likely due to the much larger number of disks and CPUs needed to examine during first startup, however at least it is way down from the 0.5-1 seconds.

Name: multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23 using old Network Manager library causing crashes
Comment_Body: Ah yeah, its about 200ms for me as well on my 14 core workstation. It loads fine in an 18.3 VM. I was testing before you opened the PR, and noticed the new NM GI binding works fine on Ubuntu 18.04 bionic as well, but it doesn't crash on the older one. I wonder why that occurs on Fedora, maybe they removed the old version altogether.  I can merge your PR, thanks for looking into this!

Name: Disk IO stat is wrong if Network stat is ON: UUID:multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23
Comment_Body: this always reproducible when "Preferences" window is opened.  ![delete](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/799021/34904406-ebcc2700-f84d-11e7-8bee-46cd3535fd91.jpg)   This gap when the preferences window is opened and remains until we close the preferences ![delete](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/799021/34904389-8c508f6e-f84d-11e7-99f5-0e88436955e9.jpg)    Here we close the preferences: ![delete](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/799021/34904394-b1b52616-f84d-11e7-8b33-55c7fc0b8106.jpg)

Name: Disk IO stat is wrong if Network stat is ON: UUID:multicore-sys-monitor@ccadeptic23
Comment_Body: All the stats will be incorrect while preferences are open because it has to check if the settings have changed on an interval and reset the measurement. It gets those speed numbers by comparing two different timestamps, but if the timestamps constantly reset it breaks. These timestamps reset after every settings change, which occurs constantly to check for settings changes while prefs are open. I don't intend to fix this anytime soon since it doesn't impact normal operation.

Name: clipboard-qr@wrouesnel doesn't work with LM 18.3
Comment_Body: If maintainer would like to patch this nice applet the solution is simple. According to Cinnamon 3.6.7 changelog (https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/blob/master/debian/changelog) the function signature was changed for St.Clipboard.get_text to support different types of clipboard. A simple patch is needed on the indicated line in applet.js to add St.ClipboardType.CLIPBOARD as first argument of clipboard.get_text in on_applet_clicked event sink. This will of course break compatibility to previous cinnamon versions so I'm looking forward to a smarter implementation from the main developer.

Comment_Body: @spacy01 I can give you the console commands you need to execute, so you can retrieve the user's hash, but I don't know how to obtain the command's result from the Cinnamon's API.  So first we need to get the HTML page (with the player's iframe): `$ wget -r -l1 -H -Dcdn.bg -O /tmp/bnt.txt http://tv.bnt.bg/bnt1/16x9/ ` Than we need to grep for the hash: `$ grep playlist.m3u8 /tmp/bnt.txt |cut -c84-115`  If we assume that the result of the previous is assigned to a variable x, your rtmpdump should look like this: `Main.Util.spawnCommandLine("bash -c \"rtmpdump -r 'http://ios.cdn.bg:2020/fls' -a 'fls' -f 'WIN 11,5,502,149' -p 'http://cdn.bg/live/8W5GA2ujvB' -W 'http://cdn.bg/eflash/jwplayer510/player.swf' -y 'bnt.stream?at=" + x + "' -b '0' | vlc --meta-title 'BNT' -\"");`  and at the end we want to remove the wget file: `$ rm -fv /tmp/bnt.txt`  If you can manage to retrieve the command results from the javascript, it should be a piece of cake. I've tried it but with no luck for some reason.

Name: BgRadio@spacy01 TV Stream for BNT* wouldn't work
Comment_Body: Thank you for the help!  First command - `wget -r -l1 -H -Dcdn.bg -O /tmp/bnt.txt http://tv.bnt.bg/bnt1/16x9/`, working like a charm! And is very helpful.  But second one, returns me error. Here is the console output:  wget -r -l1 -H -Dcdn.bg -O /tmp/bnt.txt http://tv.bnt.bg/bnt1/16x9/grep playlist.m3u8 /tmp/bnt.txt | cut -c84-115 WARNING: combining -O with -r or -p will mean that all downloaded content will be placed in the single file you specified.  --2017-12-23 09:50:04--  http://tv.bnt.bg/bnt1/16x9/grep Преобразувам tv.bnt.bg (tv.bnt.bg)... 89.252.246.202, 89.252.246.200, 89.252.246.201, ... Свързване към tv.bnt.bg (tv.bnt.bg)|89.252.246.202|:80... успешно свързване. HTTP изпратено искане, чакам отговор... 404 Not Found 2017-12-23 09:50:04 ГРЕШКА: 404: Not Found.  --2017-12-23 09:50:04--  http://playlist.m3u8/ Преобразувам playlist.m3u8 (playlist.m3u8)... неуспя: Не е известно името на услугата. wget: unable to resolve host address ‘playlist.m3u8’ /tmp/bnt.txt: Scheme missing.  And the result is empty /tmp/bnt.txt file

Name: BgRadio@spacy01 TV Stream for BNT* wouldn't work
Comment_Body: What you've pasted here is wrong. The grep seems to be attached to the previous command. Try this one: `$ wget -qr -l1 -H -Dcdn.bg -O /tmp/bnt.txt http://tv.bnt.bg/bnt1/16x9/; grep playlist.m3u8 /tmp/bnt.txt | cut -c84-115`  I've added -q to the wget so to suppress it's console output. And there is a semicolon between the two commands. The previous line should return only the hash and nothing else.

Name: [CinnVIIStarkMenu@NikoKrause] Unexpected/Inconvenient search results ordering
Comment_Body: This menu uses the same search algorithm as the default Cinnamon menu. This means search results are not rearranged by relevance, but they are sorted alphabetically.  It's been an issue in Cinnamons menu for a long time, see: https://github.com/linuxmint/Cinnamon/issues/4053  I think it's done this way, because sorting menu entries costs a lot of time.  As soon as Cinnamon improves it's sorting algorithm, I can backport it. But for now I'll stay with the current solution. I'm afraid you have to type in `teleg` instead of `tele` for now. Or use the arrow keys.  I'm closing this as an upstream issue.

Comment_Body: Ping author @mockturtl.

Name: weather@mockturtl. The city button is set to direct to us.rd.yahoo.com. Link is dead.
Comment_Body: Confirmed in my location.    The link is read from the Yahoo response data here: [applet.js#L585](https://github.com/linuxmint/cinnamon-spices-applets/blob/master/weather%40mockturtl/files/weather%40mockturtl/applet.js#L585).  ----  [Test](https://query.yahooapis.com/v1/public/yql?format=json&q=select%20*%20from%20weather.forecast%20where%20woeid=%22MY_WOEID%22%20and%20u=%22c%22) (replace your WOEID)  Output:  ```json { "query": { "count": 1, "created": "2017-12-06T00:53:24Z", "lang": "en-US", "results": { "channel": { ... "link": "http://us.rd.yahoo.com/dailynews/rss/weather/Country__Country/*https://weather.yahoo.com/country/state/city-1234567/", ... ```  I'm tempted to delete everything before the asterisk, but maybe the data format is different for other locations?

Also, if you copy icon.png to `/cryptocoin@guantanamoe/files/cryptocoin@guantanamoe/`, it will show the icon in the applet manager.
